strIntroduction: The shinkansen rail network in Japan is famous around the world for its punctuality, comfort, efficiency, safety and speed. With top speeds around 320 km/h, Japan Rail's bullet train, or shinkansen, is an experience in its own right, as well as a great way to travel. This program is a reservation for shinkansen bullet train ticket in between Tokyo/Osaka with a half day or one day private tour guide. The tour guide will arrange the trip schedule, so you can request the guide to include the places that you would like to visit. Some famous sightseeing spots for Osaka are as follows: - Osaka Castle Osaka Castle is a more recent replication of the original castle built in the 1580s. It exhibits Osaka's pas with impressive stone walls, elegant gold-leaf trim and copper roofing. An observatory is perched atop the eight-story keep, making it a great place for panoramic views of the surrounding area. - Osaka Aquarium Kaiyukan Featuring the largest aquarium tank in the world, Osaka Aquarium displays a breathtaking view of aquatic life. Favorites among the 15 natural habitats and 35,000 specimens are the Japanese Forest, whale shark, Arctic penguins and giant spider crab. -Shitennoji Temple The Shitennoji Temple site is the oldest in Japan, with the original temple being constructed in 593. Surrounding the temple are lush grounds including a serene Japanese landscape garden replete with manicured shrubbery, streams and waterfalls. - Umeda Sky Building Enjoy panoramic views of Osaka from the 39th floor of this innovative observatory in one of the city's most modern architectural structures. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ※ Important Ticket Delivery & Pickup Information - Please Read Carefully ※ 1. Ticket Delivery We will deliver your tickets to your hotel in advance for your concierge to hold for you. The tickets will be available upon check-in. If you would like us to deliver the tickets to your hotel, please provide us with the following information: - Hotel name - The full name used for your reservation - Check-in date Please note: - We require at least 3 full business days for delivery. If placing a last minute booking within 3 days of your visit, or if you do not provide us your hotel information at least 3 full business days prior your ticket date, you'll need to collect your tickets from our Tokyo office in Shibuya. - If your hotel reservation details change, please tell us immediately through the Voyagin dashboard. - We only deliver to hotels with a concierge with whom we can confirm the receipt of the ticket delivery. We do not deliver tickets to hostels, guesthouses, or private residences. Please let us know if you are not staying at a hotel so we can provide our office details for you to pickup the tickets. 2. Ticket Pickup: If you are not staying at a hotel, book within 3 days of the ticket date, or prefer to pickup your tickets, you can collect your tickets from our Tokyo office in Shibuya. Our office is located 6 minutes (on foot) from Shibuya station. Address: (English) Miyamasu ON Building 5th floor, 1-15-8 Shibuya, Shibuya-ku, Tokyo (Japanese) 〒150-0002 東京都渋谷区渋谷 1-15-8 宮益 ON ビル 5F Detailed Directions (Shibuya station to Voyagin): http://voyag.in/shibuya-station-to-voyagin-office Google Map (Shibuya station to Voyagin): http://voyag.in/voyagin-google-map

strIntroduction: This incredible 1-day bus tour is a trip the whole family can enjoy as you make your way on the breathtaking island of Okinawa. Visit four famous sightseeing spots: The Okinawa Churaumi Aquarium, Ryuguji Butterfly Garden, Nago Pineapple Park and The Glass House in the Forest. Please read information about each site below: Okinawa Churaumi Aquarium is known as one of the best aquariums in Japan! The name, chosen by Japanese people, is comprised of two words: "chura" meaning "beautiful" or "graceful" and "umi" meaning "sea". In Ocean Expo Park, which is located inside the aquarium, you can experience and understand more about the history and culture of Okinawa. The most exciting spot in the aquarium is the gigantic tank called “Kuroshio Sea Tank”, where you can see world’s largest fish, the whale shark. Also, you may have a chance to see one of the largest Manta Rays in the world, which is quite a rare sight to see. In addition, the Churaumi Aquarium is one of few aquariums in the world that has undertaken the challenging task of attempting to breed whale sharks in captivity. Ryugujo Butterfly Garden is located near the Churaumi Aquarium. Here, you can see 15 species of beautiful butterflies, and also enjoy lunch at a nearby restaurant and buy some souvenirs. From the restaurant, you can see a breathtaking view of the ocean while getting a taste of the famous “Okinawa Soba”. The most popular butterfly in the garden is “Oogomadara”, which is the largest butterfly in Japan. Nago Pineapple Park is a great place to experience all things pineapple! You can ride on a pineapple-shaped cart to explore the park, taste the differences between many kinds of pineapples, buy some goods and souvenirs, and see a pineapple gallery and wine factory. It’s a spot you can't miss if you visit Okinawa! Last is the Glass House in the Forest, where you can watch professional glass artists making Ryukyu glasses. At the souvenir shop, there are over 200 types of colorful Ryukyu glassware including awamori bottles, tableware and much more! This tour is available everyday. ※Itinerary※ - 8:00 - 10:35 Meet your guide at your designated hotel *Please note - meeting time depends on your hotel - 11:20 - 12:10 Ryuguji Butterfly Garden * You can go shopping and eat lunch at this location. - 12:15 - 15:15 Okinawa Churaumi Aquarium - 15:40 - 16:15 Nago Pineapple Park - 16:20 - 16:40 The Glass House in the Forest *You can see and buy Ryukyu glass originally made in Okinawa. 17:00 – 19:45 The tour ends at designated hotels. *Please note - drop-off time depends on your hotel Place for the departure/arrival can be chosen from the following places below. strIntroduction: Origami is an ancient traditional Japanese art of folding paper to make interesting and beautiful figures. In this two hour class you will learn about the history and culture of this unusual art and learn how to make several different kinds of shapes out of paper. You may choose to make the most classic famous Japanese Crane, which has become one of the symbols of Japan. There is a belief that if you make 1,000 Japanese cranes within a year, your wish will come true. That's why you can see bundles of thousands of colorful cranes called Senbazuru hanging at temples. However, origami is much more than that. There are thousands of figures you can make out of paper. In this class you will also learn how to make Kusudama - a star-like figure made of many smaller pieces of paper. The class is 2 hours long and can be started any time between 11 am and 3 pm. *Please choose the appropriate option when booking the tour. The price is per person, so if your group is 2 or more participants, please book the tour the according number of times.
strTitle: Enjoy an Origami Crafting Lesson in Nagoya

strIntroduction: We provide two options for this cooking class: Option 1: Japan Soul Food What do Japanese people eat at home on a typical day? Find out what the staple Japanese foods are and how to cook them home-style, with a local. During this class we will cook a standard lunch or dinner meal consisting of several simple but delicious dishes. Option 2: Nagoya Traditional Cuisine Did you know that every area in Japan has its own traditional regional foods? In Nagoya, people cherish their local dishes such as misokatsu – pork cutlet with red miso sause, tebasaki – deep-fried chicken wings, kishimen – flat noodles, tenmusu – riceball with cooked shrimp, and many others. During this class we will teach you how to make some of the most loved Nagoya foods like a real Nagoyajin! ALSO: Learn how to use red miso paste - the very Nagoyan ingredient and make dishes with it! BONUS: Visit a local supermarket with a guide and learn how it's different from the one in your country. *Please choose the appropriate option when booking the tour. The price is per person, so if your group is 2 or more participants, please book the tour the according number of times.
strTitle: Learn to Cook Traditional Nagoya Cuisine and More

strIntroduction: You will take a morning walk through sleepy Nagoya to Nagoya Fish Market and see freshly caught fish being sold and prepared for the restaurants and shops for the day. Founded over 100 years ago, the market has over 400 stalls and shops and provides seafood for the entire city. You will see giant Maguro (tuna) being sliced with huge swords and special machines, fugu (poisonous puffer-fish) being prepared by the professional cooks, and many other types of fish and seafood in all variety being sold. You will also be able to buy seafood and other goods such as pickles, seaweed, senbei (rice crackers), and much more. After the tour of the fish market, we will take you to the sushi restaurant nearby serving the fresh fish from the market, or we will buy fish at the market and head back to Nishiasahi guest house to enjoy a sushi cooking class, where the Master will teach you how to properly prepare and slice the fish and make perfect nigiri-zushi. After the cooking class you will be able to make great sushi anywhere, anytime. Without cooking class 7:00 meet at Nagoya Station, walk to the market 7:20 Arrive at the market and stroll around with your guide 8:00 eat breakfast 8:40 buy omiyage 9:00 end of the tour With cooking class 7:00 meet at Nagoya Station, walk to the market 7:20 Arrive at the market and stroll around with your guide, pick up fish 8:00 walk to Nishiasahi 8:15 start cooking 9:00 breakfast 9:30 end of the tour *Please choose the appropriate option when booking the tour. strIntroduction: Enjoy a fine meal at a traditional style Japanese restaurant in the company of two charming Maiko and Geiko, and their musician. Geiko and Maiko, who are considered walking pieces of art, are Japanese female entertainers who dance, play games, and entertain guests at a banquet. The Maiko will perform some of their most popular dances, including the Nagoya’s favourite Shachihoko dance (that you can see only in Nagoya), just for you and your friends. You can play some games with Maiko, ask them questions, take pictures together, or even challenge the Shachihoko performance yourself! This is a unique opportunity to experience both traditional Japanese stage performances and eat a multi-dish kaiseki meal in a splendid restaurant with rich history and classical atmosphere. On this tour you will meet your guide-interpreter and go to a gorgeous Japanese-style restaurant located in the city's former samurai residence. Many of these restaurants are difficult to book and enter, but you will have the unique chance to relish the taste of a delicious multi-dish kaiseki lunch or dinner in a classical atmosphere specially during the event. *Please choose the appropriate option when booking the tour. The price is per person, so if your group is 2 or more participants, please book the tour the according number of times.

strIntroduction: Make a reservation for Kiroro Ski Resort and enjoy your winter by skiing at one of the best ski park in Japan! Kiroro Ski Resort is located approximately 43 km west of Sapporo Hokkaido, approximately a 90 minutes by car from Chitose Airport and 60 minutes by car from Niseko. Kiroro Ski Resort offers ski school service, a snow park for children, snow shoe tours, and snow cat tours. Kiroro is a child friendly ski resort, as it is equipped with a day car “Kids Room” available when the mountain center is open, and a day nursery (available everyday) making it a great ski resort for the family. Compare to other ski resorts in Hokkaido, Kiroro Ski Resort is less well known, but it has the most modern and newest facilities and infrastructures. In addition, this resort is also lack of crowds and has well established Kids club, making it perfect for the families. The resort has 21 runs suited to all levels including beginner, intermediate, and advanced with fantastic snow powder running throughout the trees. In addition, there are also mogul courses and a basic terrain park. The facilities and services at Kiroro resort are well organized with a modern lift system. If you do not wish to ski or snowboard, Kiroro Ski Resort offers you other services such as indoor and open hot springs, swimming pool and day spa inside the resort building, snow cat sightseeing tours, snow shoe tours, sledding, and snow tubing. Kiroro Ski Resort also has games arcade with billiards and pachinko. This tour package offers you both the admission ticket for the ski park and the transportation. As for transportation, it has several options that you can choose as follows: Private taxi transfer to or from Sapporo (2-4 people) Private taxi transfer to or from Sapporo (5-9 people) Shared bus transfer to or from Sapporo Ski & Snowboard rental for private taxi transfer Ski & Snowboard rental for shared bus Private taxi transfer to or from Chitose Airport (2-4 people, optional) Private taxi transfer from Chitose Airport to Sapporo (2-4 people, optional) Private taxi transfer from Sapporo to Chitose Airport (2-4 people, optional) Private taxi transfer to or from Chitose Airport (5-9 people, optional) Private taxi transfer from Chitose Airport to Sapporo (5-9 people, optional) Private taxi transfer from Sapporo to Chitose Airport (5-9 people, optional)
strTitle: Reservation for Ski Tour at Kiroro From Sapporo in Hokkaido!

strIntroduction: Make a reservation for Sapporo Kokusai Skiing Resort and enjoy your winter by skiing at one of the best ski park in Japan! Sapporo Kokusai Skiing Resort is located within Jozankei Onsen hot spring area near Sapporo, and it attracts not only local skiers but also many repeaters from outside Hokkaido. The resort has a lot of amount of snow and many courses for all level of skiers, even though it is located very close to the cities (within 60 and 40-minute drive from Sapporo and Otaru, approximately). This resort is very popular among skiers, as they can ski at this park until the Golden Week holiday season in May every year. The main attraction of this resort is the Sky Cabin gondolas, which each car is capable to carry eight skiers at once. The Merchen Daiichi lift also available here and it can carry four skiers at once. A 3.6-kilometer Rinkan Course-Marchen Course offers exhilarating and satisfying glade skiing in the wildness. This course is a perfect course for all level of skiers, even entry-level skiers can enjoy skiing safely. There are seven courses such as the Downhill course for advanced skiers, Swing course for intermediate skiers and Woody course for beginners. Each slope is wide and long, enabling skiers to enjoy skiing in accordance with their levels. This tour package offers you both the admission ticket for the ski park and the transportation. As for transportation, it has several options that you can choose from as follows: - Private taxi transfer to or from Sapporo (2-4 people) - Private taxi transfer to or from Sapporo (5-9 people) - Shared bus transfer to or from Sapporo - Ski & Snowboard rental for private taxi transfer - Ski & Snowboard rental for shared bus - Private taxi transfer to or from Chitose Airport (2-4 people, optional) - Private taxi transfer from Chitose Airport to Sapporo (2-4 people, optional) - Private taxi transfer from Sapporo to Chitose Airport (2-4 people, optional) - Private taxi transfer to or from Chitose Airport (5-9 people, optional) - Private taxi transfer from Chitose Airport to Sapporo (5-9 people, optional) - Private taxi transfer from Sapporo to Chitose Airport (5-9 people, optional)
strTitle: Reserve a Tour for Sapporo Kokusai Skiing Resort, Hokkaido!

strIntroduction: Explore Hakone at your pace with the Hakone freepass independent package tour. The pass includes a one way ticket to Hakone on the Odakyu Romance car departing from Shinjuku station. In Hakone, you'll have access to most of local transportation to visit Hakone's best spots to admire Mt. Fuji like Hakone Tozan or Hakone pirate ship. Since there is no scheduled itinerary or guide, you can explore Hakone at your own pace, and decide what sights to visit. When you get hungry, head to Nanakamado for a traditional Japanese lunch (included in the price). The pass also includes discounts for over 50 facilities including museums and other tourists attractions. You can also stop at Gotemba Premium Outlet for a little bit of shopping before getting back to Tokyo by bus. Make the most out of your trip to Hakone with the Hakone freepass!
strTitle: Explore the best of Hakone with a one day package pass

strIntroduction: A great time and money-saver, this tour will allow you to visit some of Kyoto's famous places all from the comfort of a beautiful double-decker bus. This bus is an open Top SKY BUS which allows you to feel the breeze and atmosphere of Kyoto. With so many different sites to choose from, it can be hard to decide where to go, so leave it up to us as we take you through a stress-free, hassle-free tour of one of the most famous cities in the world. The places we will visit are as follows: - Kinkakuji Temple Also known as the famous "Temple of the Golden Pavilion," Kinkakuji Temple is one of the most iconic and famous sites in Kyoto. Gold leaf, which is gold hammered into thin sheets, covers the outside of the first two floors. The temple is particularly unique in that each floor is built in a different architectural style. - Kiyomizudera Temple Built in 778, Kiyomizudera Temple one of Japan's great World Heritage Sites. 139 cedar poles hold up this great structure, which allow visitors a fantastic view of the city. Kiyomizu means pure water, and many people come to this temple to wish for wealth, success in love, and a long life. Schedule (morning tour): 10:00 Meeting at Kyoto Station Karasuma Bus Terminal - Nishihonganji Temple - Nijo Castle - Seimei Shrine - Kitano Tenmangu - Kinkakuji Temple (40 minutes) - Daitokuji Temple - Reizei House - Kyoto Gardens - Kamocho Bridge - Lake Biwa Canal - Heian Shrine - Shorenin Temple - Chionin Temple - Yasaka Shrine - Kiyomizudera Temple (70 minutes) - Kyoto Tower 14:30 Tour ends at Kyoto Station Karasuma Bus Terminal. Schedule (afternoon tour): 13:00 Meeting at Kyoto Station Karasuma Bus Terminal - Nishihonganji Temple - Nijo Castle - Seimei Shrine - Kitano Tenmangu - Kinkakuji Temple (40 minutes) - Daitokuji Temple - Reizei House - Kyoto Gardens - Kamocho Bridge - Lake Biwa Canal - Heian Shrine - Shorenin Temple - Chionin Temple - Yasaka Shrine - Kiyomizudera Temple (70 minutes) - Kyoto Tower 17:30 Tour ends at Kyoto Station Karasuma Bus Terminal.

strIntroduction: Imagine, you meet locals and get some information that is NOT listed in guidebooks, nor even in social networks. Do you know the word "Salaryman"? It is a generic name for normal office workers. They often go for a drink with their bosses and colleagues after work in a practice called Nominication. Now you can experience this culture. Join us! First of all, I will pick you up at your accommodation or we will meet up somewhere you like. Then we will go around a local town. Even if it is touristy area, I will show you places that tourists don't know and just pass. After that we will go to an Izakaya alley and enjoy foods and drinks: Yakitori, Seafood BBQ, Okonomiyaki, etc. The price is per person and includes foods and drinks, doesn't include transportation. If you have any requests or questions, please don't hesitate to ask. I look forward to meeting you.
strTitle: Experience "Nominication" drinking with locals in Tokyo

strIntroduction: From quick izakaya-food to sake, you can get multiple types of food/drinks at reasonable price and enjoy the local atmosphere at the same time.
strTitle: Japanese Sake Tasting Tour: Local Tokyo Food & Drink

strIntroduction: Discover the off-the-beaten path izakaya and food stands where local residents frequent after a long day of work.
strTitle: Local White Collars Eat & Drink: Work Hard Play Harder

strIntroduction: First, I pick you up at your accommodation in Tokyo. After we meet up, we go to Shinjuku for a unique experience with local people, including calligraphy. Calligraphy is one of the unique arts of the East. In it, beauty is sought through shape and position of characters drawn, the gradation of the ink, and the force of the brush stokes. During the tour, we will have lunch or dinner together. The tour is 5-hour-long and the price includes everything you need for calligraphy. You can take the tour as a couple, a group or a family (min 2, max 6). The tour is available almost everyday. I can offer a flexible schedule. If you have any questions, please don't hesitate to ask. Enjoy the tour with Tokyo's locals!
strTitle: Try the unique experience "Calligraphy with locals"

strIntroduction: Shirahama Onsen is the perfect place for a relaxing getaway. Located at the tip of Boso Peninsula, Chiba, you are sure to feel like you have arrived at an island paradise! Enjoy this 2-day bus tour to some of the most popular highlights of Chiba prefecture! The bus will stop at great, natural places on the way to the hotel. One stop will be at the famous Mt Nokogiri from where you can take a panoramic view over the "Hell valley" and the Tokyo Bay. Take in the natural sites and enjoy the delicious cuisine prepared by the hotel. The hotel staff will prepare a delicious seafood buffet with local specialties! After your dining experience take a dip in the relaxing hot springs. The next day on the way back to Shinjuku you will also have a chance to see more beautiful scenery on our way, such as the Nomizo Falls which are rapidly gaining popularity on social media. You will even get to ride briefly a scenic local train! This tour is only available in spring, so book your tickets today! Below is the schedule of the tour: Day 1 7:40 am: Shinjuku departure - Egawa Coast (40 min) - Mt Kanou Kujukutani Observatory Park (30 min) - Mt. Nokogiri･View of Hell (30 min) - Strawberry picking at Tomiura or Tateyama (30 min) - Cape Nojimazaki (30 min) Stay at Shirahama Onsen Day 2 Depart from the hotel at Shirahama Onsen - Chikura's flower gardens (30 min) - Kamogawa shopping (25 min) - Nomizo Falls (40 min) - take the scenic Isumi Railway from Kazusa-Nakano Station (20 min) - Tokyo German Village illuminations (50 min) Arrive back to Shinjuku around 21:20 pm. Note: Rooms will be shared by 2, 3 or 4 people. This tour is provided by YOKOSO Japan Tour Check the Tour Conditions link below. http://voyag.in/2diT9k2
strTitle: Enjoy Relaxing Hot Springs in the Boso Peninsula in Chiba!

strIntroduction: Kyoto is a sightseeing center where people worldwide return time and time again. Kyoto has functioned as the crossroads of Japanese history, and it was the capital of Japan for over 1,000 years. Even today, Kyoto is the cultural center of Japan, and continues to be loved by Japanese and people of the world alike. The ancient capital of Kyoto, whose traditions have been matured through the ages, is now making startling advancements. Its rich culture and experience are being utilized in modern technological industries. Why not join this half-day bus tour to stroll around 3 World Heritage sites in Kyoto: Ginkakuji Temple, Kiyomizudera Temple and Kinkakuji Temple? See the beautiful Zen rock garden, traditional landscaping and architecture of the Ginkakuji Temple. Enjoy the view of Kyoto from the balcony of the Kiyomizudera Temple and stroll through the picture-perfect gardens surrounding the iconic golden Kinkakuji Temple. You can choose from the 4 different options outlined below! The tour starts and finished at JR Kyoto Station Karasuma Bus Terminal. * You are required to check in at least 15 minutes before your scheduled tour departure with your voucher, to exchange your voucher for your ticket. If you forget your voucher, you will need to purchase a new ticket at full price. Start time 9:00: Tour runs daily 10:30: Tour runs daily 11:30: Tour runs on Saturday and holidays (between December 31 and January 4 the tour will run daily, and between January 5 and February 28 the tour will not run) Tour duration: 4.5 – 5 hours Please have lunch on your own. 1. 7 or less people for adult 2. 7 or less people for child (aged 11 or under) 3. 8 or more people for adult 4. 8 or more people for child (aged 11 or under)
strTitle: Enjoy Half-Day Bus Tour to 3 World Heritage Sites in Kyoto!

strIntroduction: Kyoto is a sightseeing center where people worldwide return time and time again and is a central point for Japanese history, and Japan's capital for over 1,000 years. Even today, Kyoto is the cultural center of Japan, and continues to be loved by Japanese people and foreigners alike. The ancient capital of Kyoto, where tie seems to have stopped still, is now making startling advancements because it's rich culture and experience are now being utilized in modern technological industries. So why not join this 1-day bus tour and stroll around 3 popular sites in Kyoto: Fushimi Inari Shrine, Kiyomizudera Temple and Kinkakuji Temple? Follow the trail of the thousand Torii gates of Fushimi Inari Shrine, leading you up into the mountain. Take magnificent photos of the corridor of red gates during your walk. Enjoy the view of Kyoto from the balcony that is the Kiyomizudera Temple. Stroll through the picture-perfect gardens surrounding the iconic golden Kinkakuji Temple. The tour starts and finishes in Osaka and the following conditions will apply: * The activity schedule is subject to change or cancellation due to weather or traffic conditions. * This is not a guided tour, but a tour operator that can speak English will be on board. You can choose among 4 different options outlined below! Meet at Hearton Hotel Nishiumeda at 8:40, or at Namba OCAT at 9:00. You will come back to Osaka around 17:00. 1. Without Lunch/Admission for adult Please have lunch on your own. The following admission fees are needed on site: Kiyomizudera Temple: 300 JPY Kinkakuji Temple: 400 JPY 2. Without Lunch/Admission for child (aged 12 or under) Please have lunch on your own. The following admission fees are needed on site: Kiyomizudera Temple: 300 JPY Kinkakuji Temple: 400 JPY 3. With Lunch/Admission for adult Lunch (Japanese cuisine) and admission fees for Kiyomizudera Temple and Kinkakuji Temple are included. 4. With Lunch/Admission for child (aged 12 or under) Lunch (Japanese cuisine) and admission fees for Kiyomizudera Temple and Kinkakuji Temple are included.
strTitle: Enjoy 1-Day Bus Tour to 3 Popular Sites in Kyoto from Osaka!

strIntroduction: If you want to save your time and energy but want to taste what Tokyo is like, then this tour is for you. The Tokyo Sky Bus is an Open-Top Bus Tour that will show you many famous spots in Tokyo. Routes:: -1. Imperial Palace - Ginza - Marunouchi Course (Please ask! 12 times a day) -2. Tokyo Tower - Rainbow Bridge Course (Until Mar 10:40-/12:40-/14:40-/16:40 From April 10:30- /17:00 **Weekend & Holidays) -3. Odaiba Evening Course (Until Mar 18:10-20:30/ From April 17:40-20:00) -4. NEW! Christmas Illuminations Course (only until December 25, 18:00/19:00) Route Details: -Imperial Palace - Ginza - Marunouchi Course (50 minutes) The highlight of this course is in seeing the mixture of modern and old architectural styles. The Imperial Palace is an oasis-like place in Tokyo where you can see trees, water and even swans. The beautiful stone walls all around the palace remain from the Edo Era. Japan's government building is also nearby. Ginza is famous in Asia as a luxury shopping area with a long history and many historical buildings. -Tokyo Tower - Rainbow Bridge Course (60 minutes) This is a great place to take an open-top bus since it passes very close to Japan's famous Tokyo Tower. First up, the bus will pass by the Imperial Palace and then Tokyo tower leading on to the seaside area of Tokyo where you will see the Rainbow Bridge and then Tsukiji, the worlds largest seafood market. Finally, the bus will head to the Ginza area. -Odaiba Evening Course (120 minutes) Picture all the sparkles at night in Tokyo. Starting from historical Imperial Palace to red and white colored lovely Tokyo tower and go over 7 colored Rainbow Bridge. Taking a 60 minutes rest at a park to see a night view of Tokyo. And coming back to Tokyo area through Ginza. It's good idea to explore around in Tokyo on foot while in a day light and take this tour at night to have different view of Tokyo. -Christmas Illumination Course (60 minutes) On this course you'll be able to see some of Tokyo's best year-end illumination lights at iconic spots such as Tokyo Tower, Roppongi Hills, Tokyo Midtown, the Diet building (the Parliament) and more! Get into the Christmas mood by immersing yourself into the endless sea of lights!
strTitle: Ride the Tokyo Sky Bus on a Tour around Tokyo

strIntroduction: Okinawa is Japan's southernmost prefecture, consisting of a few dozen, small islands in the southern half of the Nansei Shoto, the island chain which stretches over about one thousand kilometers from Kyushu to Taiwan. Okinawa's climate is subtropical, with temperatures barely falling below 15 degrees in winter. The seas surrounding Okinawa's Islands are considered among the world's most beautiful with coral reefs and abundant marine wildlife. Consequently, snorkeling and scuba diving are among Okinawa's top attractions. So why not try a helicopter flight and look down on Okinawa from the sky! You can choose from 3 different options outlined below! For all the courses, you can board the helicopter alone, and the maximum number of passengers is 5. The helicopter leaves and arrives at Naha Airport. The following conditions will apply: * The flight may be cancelled due to bad weather. * The flight course may be changed due to weather. * Tax and insurance are included in the price. * Possible reservation time: 10:00 – 16:00 * Please come to Naha Airport at least 40 minutes before your reservation time. If you are late, you may not be able to board the helicopter. 1. Chibishi - Maejima Course This course allows you to view the Chibishi Atoll, consisting of Nagan'nu Island, Kamiyama Island and Kuefu Island, as well as Maejima and Hate Island. Flight time: Approximately 20 minutes 2. Mystical Kudaka Island Course On this course, you can view Kudaka Island, renowned as one of the leading power spots (spiritual destinations) of the prefecture. Why not experience viewing the mystical island where it is said the God Amamikiyo created the Ryukyus? Flight time: Approximately 20 minutes 3. Kerama Islands National Park Course This course flies around the Kerama Islands which were designated a national park on March 5, 2014 (Coral Day). Even if you are not good at diving, you can enjoy a superb view from the sky. Flight time: Approximately 30 minutes
strTitle: Enjoy the Amazing View from a Helicopter in Okinawa!

strIntroduction: This is a 2-hour private taxi tour which will take you to little known spiritual "power spots" in Kanazawa - temples and shrines known as places where you can receive divine blessings for love, luck, success in work, marriage, and much more! Get picked up at your hotel in Kanazawa city and tour the hidden beauties listed below: - Kifune Myoujin This is a unique shrine known to offer divine blessings both for "finding love" and for "separation". According to the legend, the very jealous wife of a local samurai became enshrined here as his last will was that a shrine was built to pacify "female jealousy, the most heart-breaking thing in this world". Worshipers should watch out when they visit this shrine. When you pass the large torii gates, you will see a bigger shrine on the left which brings fulfillment in love. But you will also see a smaller shrine on the right side where the deity of separation is enshrined. Make sure to pray at the correct shrine to avoid receiving unwanted blessings! - Korinji Temple This temple was built by Aoki Gohei, one of the chief retainers of the Maeda clan in 1650. It's a famou place to pray for love and marriage! This temple's talismans are thought to have magical power, therefore collecting the talismans of you Chinese zodiac sign and your partner's Chinese zodiac sign is thought to bring eternal fulfillment. There is a deity protecting childbirth and children as well. At Korinji you are supposed to pray in the following way: walk three times around the "Road of Happiness" inside the temple's garden, then touch the image of your Chinese zodiac sign, and finally pray at the statue of Fudo deity. If you touch it, it will bless with a white and beautiful skin! - Ishiura Shrine Ishiura is believed to be the oldest shrine in Kanazawa city. There are many blessings that you can receive here, but particularly popular are the wishes for safe birth and fulfillment in love. Many couples visit this place to pray for their successful future. Enjoy this spiritual tour to some of Kanazawa's magical "power spots"!
strTitle: Enjoy divine blessings of love & luck at Kanazawa's temples

strIntroduction: In this exciting tour in downtown Kanazawa you will have the chance to experience local crafts, sweets, green tea, sightseeing in one of Japan's three best gardens Kenrokuen, and finally receive a miniature model of a samurai armour as a souvenir! Below is the itinerary of the tour: 13:30 - Gather at "Nosaku", a famous classical studio for gold lacquer decoration with a long history 13:30 - 15:00 - Try gold lacquer decoration, one of Kanazawa's great arts 15:00 - 15:30 - Enjoy the delicious taste of Kanazawa sweets and green tea at the cafe on the second floor of "Nosaku" 15:30 - 17:00 - Enjoy strolling around Kenrokuen garden (there is no guide, but you will receive an English-language map and a ticket at "Nosaku"). Kenrokuen is just 3-5 minutes walk from "Nosaku". After you explore the beautiful garden, you will be able to pick up your souvenir (a miniature model of a samurai armour and helmet) at a designed shop inside the garden. Use the exchange ticket that you will be given at "Nosaku". A great way to continue the trip on your own is to visit the 21st Century Museum of Contemporary Art located not far from Kenrokuen. About "makie" (gold lacquer decoration) Makie is one of Japan's traditional crafts that you can try in this tour. Kanazawa is famous for its gold leaf and you will use gold decoration in this experience. You will decorate a small tray that has already been covered with lacquer. You can choose between 3 different decoration patterns. Special utensils will be prepared for small children. Of course, you can write your name on the tray as well! Make this your original souvenir and take it home with you! It will always remind you of your trip to Kanazawa and its rich culture. About Kenrokuen Enjoy strolling the beautiful Kenrokuen garden after eating sweets at the shop. Kenrokuen is known as one of Japan's three best gardens and its style is representative of the Edo period. It was built by the powerful Kaga clan and it took many years to finalize its shape. Now you can enjoy the beauty of all four seasons in Kenrokuen. At the shop "Kenrokutei" located inside the garden you will be able to exchange your ticket for a wonderful souvenir: a miniature model of a samurai armour! You will also receive an English-language map and will be able to explore the garden even without a guide. Enjoy its beauty at your own pace! About the miniature samurai armour model: You can choose between the armour models of Kaga clan's leader Maeda Toshiie and the famous samurai Oda Nobunaga, Toyotomi Hideyoshi, Uesugi Kenshin, Naoe Kanetsugu, Maeda Toshimasa. The model comes with a plastic case. You can receive one model if your group consists of up to 3 people. A group of 4 to 6 people will receive 2 models. This is a wonderful souvenir for foreign visitors! Other points of interest we recommend (but not included in the tour) are 21st Century Museum of Contemporary Art and Kanazawa Castle.
strTitle: Try Traditional Crafts & Get a Samurai Armour Model,Kanazawa

strIntroduction: As a visitor to Tokyo, you're quite likely to see the main historical points and oldest temples that the guidebooks say are must-sees. But what do locals really like to do on a weekend and how they enjoy strolling while avoiding crowds? Omotesando tends to be considered an unrivaled shopping street in Japan (from low-end to high-end), while still being a residential area for many people. Did you know there's a small and silent garden in one of Tokyo's museums in the busiest area in Aoyama? Did you know there's a tiny boutique selling Japanese traditional-style goods just off the main street? Wonder where we go to escape the tourists? Well, walk with me. I'll show you the inside scoops. We'll be walking, sometime catching public transport, going to cafes, restaurants, pubs, markets, shops... and of course all the little places and cultural events going on in between that you would never have the opportunity to explore if you didn't know a local!
strTitle: Stroll like a real Tokyo local in Aoyama/Omotesando, Tokyo

strIntroduction: In this authentic experience you will learn how to make delicious sushi by a professional in Nara. Soup will also be prepared from soup stock. The entire experience takes about 1 hour and 30 minutes. First, you will have the chance to wear a professional chef costume so that you can feel like you've become a skillful chef. The instructor will then explain the procedure of making sushi, and you will be able to make yours in about 20 minutes. Next, we will eat the sushi together with the soup. Finally, a certificate of completion of the course will be issued for you. Please come to this class with your curiosity and hunger! Below is the schedule of the classes (please choose a time slot when booking): Class 1 10:00-11:30 Class 2 11:30-13:00 Class 3 13:00-14:30 Class 4 14:30-16:00
strTitle: Enjoy an Authentic Sushi Making Class in Nara

strIntroduction: Japanese language is very easy and fun. We will never make you feel boring . This is a very dynamic and exciting lesson in which we'll introduce trendy things that that young Japanese like. Our school is located near Otome Road in Ikebukuro which is famous as a cosplay area. In this lesson, you can learn the following useful Japanese phrases: You can discount the price when buying. Even if you're lost, you can ask the way in Japanese. You can order in Japanese at a restaurant. You can decline an invitation for a date. Your favorite comics will be available as teaching materials.

Enjoy a Tokyo private tour with Narita Airport pick-up!

strIntroduction: Reserve your airport transfer from Kyoto city centre to Kansai International airport with a limousine bus! The bus departs from 9 convenient locations in Kyoto city centre to terminal 1 and terminal 2 at Kansai International airport. *No service from Kansai International airport to Kyoto city centre. Stops: -Kansai airport Terminal 1 (bus platform 8) -Kansai airport Terminal 2 (bus platform 1) -Highway Kyotanabe -Demachi-yanagi station -Nijo station -Shijo Omiya -Sanjo Keihan -Kyoto city Hall -Karasuma Oike -Shijo Karasuma -Horikawa Gojo -Kyoto station Some information about main stops along the route: -At Sanjo Keihan look out for foreign brands such as Starbucks and McDonald's facades redesigned in Japanese style to harmonize with Kyoto city landscape. -Shijo Karasuma is the business center of Kyoto, and home of many financial companies' buildings. -Kyoto station is the main transportation hub in Kyoto, including a theater, department store, shopping mall, museum, as well as multiple restaurants and hotels.

strIntroduction: In this one day guided tour you will discover and experience the entire richness of Kanazawa's culture and historical traditions. You will understand why Kanazawa was one of the most flourishing cities in Japan during the Edo period (16-19th centuries) and why it is one of the most visited cities by tourists nowadays. Below is the itinerary of this tour: 12:30 pm - Pick up in central Kanazawa, transfer by taxi to the next spot 13:00 - 14:00 pm - Enjoy the decorative art of Kanazawa's famous gold leaf applied to a pair of chopsticks that you will make yourself! 14:10 - 15:00 pm - Wear a wonderful and stylish kimono and walk around the old streets of Higashiyama district. Have many beautiful photos taken of you during your stroll. 15:10 - 15:40 pm - Learn how to play shamisen, a traditional string musical instrument, by a local professional in atmospheric settings. 16:00 - 17:00 pm - Enjoy the refined art of Japan's tea ceremony in an old samurai residence with a history of over 300 years! 17:30 - 18:30 pm - Take a bus and arrive at Nishichaya, one of Kanazawa's most famous geisha districts where you will learn the elegant geisha etiquette and some of their favourite games. 18:30 - 20:00 pm - Have kaiseki-style multi-dish dinner at a famous Japanese restaurant and enjoy the taste of authentic Japanese cuisine 20:00 - 21:30 pm - Watch the astonishing performance of real geisha in a classical teahouse! 22:00 pm - End of the tour, transfer to your hotel by taxi This tour offers unique opportunities for experiencing the multitude of cultures, crafts and traditions that Kanazawa has in store for you!
strTitle: Experience the richness of Kanazawa's culture in one day!

Below is the itinerary of this tour: 12:30 pm - Pick up in central Kanazawa, take a local bus 13:00 - 14:00 pm - Enjoy the decorative art of Kanazawa's famous gold leaf applied to a pair of chopsticks that you will make yourself! 14:10 - 15:00 pm - Wear a wonderful and stylish kimono and walk around the old streets of Higashiyama district. strIntroduction: Escape the reality by heading out across the countryside and visit Japan's most iconic natural landmark, Mt. Fuji! This tour program will let you enjoy the breathtaking panorama from Mt. Fuji 5th station, which is located at 2,300 meters above sea level. After viewing the panorama from Mt. Fuji 5th station, you will have lunch at Hakone Lake Hotel. Hakone Lake Hotel serves a Western-style lunch, and a vegetarian menu is also available upon request. After lunch, you will be taken on the Sky Gondola, where you can see 360-degree views of the volcanic Hakone Mountains. You will also visit the Owakudani Valley, where you can see the ancient crater, smell the sulphurous fumes, and see clouds of steam rising from the crevasses. Also, make sure that you try the black boiled eggs, which is believed can prolong human's life by 7 years! In the end, you will cruise along the Lake Ashi with a pirate boat, where you can enjoy the picturesque and serene natural beauty of the crater lake, along with views of Mt. Fuji. You can choose either bus or bullet trains for the returning transportation to Tokyo. The tour will drop-off you at Tokyo station or the designated hotels. In addition, drop-offs in Odawara area are also available for those who have the JR Pass and want to spend few nights in Hakone, Yumoto, or Odawara. The itinerary for this program is as follows: - 07:30 - 09:00 Pick up at designated hotels - Fuji Skyline - 5th station - Lunch at Hakone Lake Hotel - Hakone Sky Gondola - Owakudani Valley - Pirate Boat Cruise along Lake Ashi - 19:00-20:30 Drop-off at Tokyo Station, OR Drop-offs at Designated Hotels, OR Drop-offs in Odawara area. Please note that for safety reasons, the tour might ride the Komagatake Ropeway instead of riding the Hakone Ropeway or visiting the Owakudani Valley due to the possibility of volcanic activity at Mt. Hakone. strIntroduction: This hassle-free tour is designed to give you a chance to visit and see Kyoto's top attractions and includes a day-trip to Osaka and Nara as well. The itinerary for this tour is as follows: Day 1: Pick-up from Kansai International Airport Transfer to Kyoto City *transfer services is limited to accommodations within Kyoto downtown area Day 2: Kyoto Private Walking Tour 09:00 Pick-up from accommodation (within downtown area) Places to visit: - Kinkakuji, the famed golden temple of Kyoto - Kiyomizudera, scenic spot for cherry blossom viewing & fall foliage - Higashiyama old street - Yasaka Shrine 15:00 Start of authentic tea ceremony 16:00 Tour Ends Day 3: Fushimi Private Walking Tour 09:00 Meet at Kyoto Station Places to Visit: - Fushimi Inari Shrine (known for a thousand red gates) - Chokenji Temple - Sightseeing river cruise - Sake brewery tour (optional sake tasting for an added fee) 15:00 Return to Kyoto Station/Tour ends Day 4: Nara Day Tour 10:00 Meet at Nara Station Start of Nara walking tour Places to visit: - Todaiji, home of the Giant Buddha - Nara Park, a spacious park famous for wild deers - Kasuga Grand Shrine 14:00 End of tour, return to Kyoto or continue sightseeing Day 5: Pick-up from accommodation (within downtown area) Transfer to Kansai International Airport What this tour includes: - round-trip airport transfers - English-speaking guide for the tours - round-trip tickets to Osaka and Nara via rapid train - entrance fees to attractions included in the tour *To ensure that your booking will be accepted, please book this activity at least two (2) weeks before your planned tour start date. *This tour package is not available on the following dates: April 29 to May 5, 2016; and August 11 to 16, 2016 *Itinerary may change due to local conditions

strIntroduction: Kobe is famous for its “ten-million-dollar night view!” Located between the sea and the Rokko mountain range, Kobe is also considered one of Japan's most attractive cities, so why not try it yourself and look down on Kobe from the sky! You can choose from among the 3 different courses outlined below! For all the courses, you can board the helicopter alone, or meet the maximum number of passengers, which is 5. The helicopter leaves and arrives at Kobe Air Center. The following conditions will apply: * The flight may be cancelled due to bad weather. * The flight course may be changed due to weather. * The tax and insurance are included in the price. Long Course (Flight time: Approximately 10 minutes) Enjoy viewing Kobe’s downtown, Port Tower, and more. This course is recommended as a present for someone special. 3. strIntroduction: The Tottori Sand Dunes are the largest sand dunes in Japan and Tottori's most famous tourist attraction. Located just outside the city center, they span roughly 16 kilometers of coast along the Sea of Japan and are up to two kilometers wide and 50 meters high. They are also part of the Sanin Kaigan National Park. On this trip you can enjoy an all-you-can-eat crab lunch. After the sand-dunes you'll go to Yumura Onsen, "Yumura" literally means "hot spring village", because the hot springs have long played a vital role in the town. Take a walk around this quaint old town and take a rest in the 21 meter long foot-bath along the river. strIntroduction: Below are the details of this home cooking class in Tokyo: 1. We meet at the Kyodo Station (on Odakyu line) 2. We go to the local supermarket and get some of the foods and ingredients. (About 20-30 minutes) 3. We move to YUCa's private kitchen by taxi. 4. During the class: Many secret tips and techniques! Enjoy! Sample recipe: 1) Dashi - We will by making a real dashi stock by taking cooked bonito flakes and dried konbu. 2) Miso Soup - By using the Dashi, tofu and wakame seaweed, we make the miso soup. In our class, we use a brown type of miso because this type of miso is the most popular and common in Japanese home cooking. Depending on the season, we will also change the types of vegetables used in the soup. 3) Japanese rice - We will use a typical Japanese rice. 4) Fried Salmon with onion vinegar sauce – We will cook the salmon by using potato starch. We will also prepare the sweet sour tasty sauce. 5) Green beans with sesame sauce - It's one of the popular dishes at Japanese home. We will use a special bowl to grind the sesame and make the tasty sauce. 6) Pickles – We will make quick and easy pickles with using seasonal vegetables. 7) Dessert - We will have the Japanese flavor ice cream topped with special syrup. 5. Japanese table settings 6. Tasting *Feel free to ask YUCa questions about the food, Japanese culture and people, or anything else about Japan. 8. The class ends! * Every class starts at 10:00 am and finishes at 13:00 pm. * We also provide private classes as well. Please feel free to contact us!

strIntroduction: This is a unique tour to one of Tokyo's local neighbourhoods (Fukagawa) that is held only once a month. You can enjoy 3 interesting Experiences for only a half day. Duration: 09:30 am - 14:00 pm We will meet at Monzen-nakacho Station - just 5 minutes from Otemachi Station (Central Tokyo) by subway. Then we will walk to Myougaku Temple and our half day unforgettable Tokyo Experience activities will start there. Do it yourself: Zazen Experience You will enjoy experiencing a short session of Zazen. The spirit of Japanese Zen appeals to many people including the late Steve Jobs who is the founder of Apple. The practice of Zen is simply devoting oneself to "Zazen (坐禅）". Zazen is the way of Zen practice where you sit in "Agura" (cross-legged) style with your back straight for about 5-15 minites and relinquish all worldly desires while meditating. It is said that you reach a higher stage by focusing on sitting, quietly looking inwards. The 1-hour experience meditation (Zazen) session at Myougaku Temple is conducted by the vice priest of the temple Mr. Mukai. *No prior experience is required *Please attend with comfortable and loose clothes. Plan It Yourself: Exploration Walking After Zazen, you will enjoy exploration walking. This walking event is different from the guided walking tour but it is more like a treasure hunt walk. You will receive the map and the list of missions. Then you will start exploring the small historical ward called “Fukagawa” to clear as many missions as you can within 1 hour. In order to complete the missions, you will stray back to hidden street, take photos and feel the Japanese local life there. You will surely enjoy your exploration walking to discover the spirit of Japan. Make It Yourself: Hiroshima Okonomiyaki Cooking Lesson Learn the history of Hiroshima Okonomiyaki and how to make it with professional Chef Hiromi. Hiroshima Okonomiyaki is very popular among the health conscious Japanese and this Japanese home cooking is loved by men, women, and children of all ages. You will also enjoy 2 other dishes. In addition to cooking, you will learn "Oko-Art" which is special decoration on Okonomiyaki during the 2-hour workshop. "Oko-Art" is essential to making Okonomiyaki party at home. This hands-on experience takes place at the nice and clean Otafuku Kitchen in Tokyo. This class is limited up to 24 people. You will use a special Japanese thin hand “Otafuku” original towel called "Tenugui" and an “Otafuku” original apron during the cooking lesson and you are allowed to take these special goods home with you. You will always remember the Japanese Otafuku-san who has thin eyes showing an ever smiling face, low nose representing humility, tiny mouth implying that she does not waste her words, large ears signifying her ability to listen, robust cheeks indicating a healthy body and mind, and wide forehead portraying her wisdom.
strTitle: Experience Tokyo through Zen, Walking and Okonomiyaki

strIntroduction: From Osaka, you'll be transported to Fukuoka via the exquisite shinkansen (bullet train). To top it off, we are able to book front row seats for you to enjoy the festival parade at its fullest - which also gives you better photo opportunities. And, yes, a hotel for 1 night. Hakata Dontaku (Holiday) is a festival that has attracted over two million people, with the festival parade being a favorite among many. It's also regarded as one of the best festivals in Japan. The festival spans for two days, from May 3rd to May 4th. It also dates back to 1179 as a New Year's parade in honor of the feudal lord of the time. Today, it has slightly altered and is celebrated as a citizens festival. The city hosts a variety of activities, such as parades (with various costumes), traditional dance performances, floats, night illuminations, food stalls, stage shows, and folk songs, among many others. In addition, 30+ stages are set up, making for a festive atmosphere throughout the city. The vehicles that fill Meiji Street, one of the busiest streets in Fukuoka, are replaced with 200+ parade groups along the street, which last throughout the two day festival. You'll also want to be on the look out for the "flower cars" that are present during the festival. Two are decorated with artificial flowers, and the other with LED lights to exhilarate the atmosphere. And if you're fond of heat, then the warmer weather will only compliment your experience. Oh, and if you've never heard traditional Japanese music in real life, you're in for a treat. The shamisen, a three-stringed lute, will also be played during the festival. In this tour you can book the following package: - transportation by bullet train from Osaka to Hakata (Fukuoka) - one-night of accommodation in a local hotel - special front-row seats for the parade of Hakata Dontaku - as an option, you can book also return bullet train tickets Enjoy Fukuoka's Hakata Dontaku festival during your trip to Japan in May!
strTitle: See Fukuoka's Hakata Dontaku Festival from the front row!

strIntroduction: This wonderful tour starts from Tokyo and will take you to the following places: 1. Odawara Castle Park Odawara Castle, a symbol of Odawara city was once under control of the famous Hojo Clan in 1495. During the Meiji Era, the castle was pulled down because the government ordered to destroy all former feudal fortifications. In 1950, the area was turned into Odawara Castle Park, then in 1960, “Tenshukaku”, the tower of the castle was reconstructed. Because of the renovation for earthquake resistant, the castle is closed by the end of April. However, you can still enjoy a stroll around the castle and cherry blossom viewing! The white tower of the tenshukaku and pink petals of sakura are great combination for photo shootings! 2. Lunch at Minoya Kichibei in Odawara The bus tours for foodies are very popular in Japan. They are reasonable in price, and full of enjoyable things. In this tour, you can taste crabs and all-you-can-eat buffet at the ocean-view restaurant. Enjoy Japanese, Chinese, and Western style dishes with fresh local ingredients. 3. Strawberry Picking in Izu Visit a local farm in Izu for strawberry picking. You can pick your own strawberry inside a greenhouse and take a bite. Once you get to know a taste of fresh strawberry, you cannot forget its juiciness, texture, flavor and aroma. 4. Hakone Sightseeing Cruise on Lake Ashi Lake Ashi is a crater lake which was formed after the volcanic eruption 3000 years ago. You can cruise on a boat and enjoy a beautiful scenery of Mt. Fuji and ridges of Mt. Hakone. The boat takes you about 30 min. cruising from one end of the lake to the other end. 5. Seafood Market in Numazu “Numazu Gourmet Kaido no Eki” is selling fish, seafood products, green tea and even sweets. Shop for tasty local delicacies or souvenirs for friends and family back home, enjoying vibrant atmosphere of the market. There are seafood restaurants and standing sushi bar. ●Itinerary Choose 08:50 am at Shinjuku Washington Hotel ↓ Odawara Castle Park and Cherry Blossom Viewing (70 mins) ↓ Lunch at Minoya Kichibei in Odawara (50 mins) ↓ Lake Ashi Sightseeing Cruise ↓ Strawberry Picking in Izu (30 mins) ↓ Numazu Gourmet Kaido no Eki (30 mins) ↓ 18:00 pm Go back to Shinjuku This tour is provided by YOKOSO Japan Tour Check the Tour Conditions link below. http://voyag.in/2diT9k2
strTitle: Enjoy Sakura, Hakone Cruise & Strawberry Picking from Tokyo

strIntroduction: This bus tour is perfect for those who want to enjoy flower fardens, a delicious buffet lunch, Mt. Fuji and Shibazakura Festival all at once! Shibazakura Festival Shibazakura Festival is the flower festival of moss phlox, which petals are shaped like cherry blossoms with many color variations such as pink, white, and light purple. The venue o Shibazakura Festival is located at the foothill of Mt. Fuji, which is close to Lake Motosu, one of the Mt. Fuji’s five lakes. There are 800,000 shibazakura that grow thickly covering almost 2.4 hectares of the field. The views of Mt. Fuji and the Shibazakura field are very stunning, so you cant take a lot of beautiful photographs. You can also enjoy some local foods and sweets at the venue, and you can also refresh yourself by soaking your feet in the food bath while enjoying the beautiful scenery of Mt. Fuji and Shibazakura field. There are many food stalls selling local foods and sweets at the venue. ●Itinerary 08:30 AM Meet at Shinjuku Washington Hotel, departure ↓ Grinpa's flower gardens and tulip festival near Mt Fuji (60 min.) ↓ Mori no Eki "Fuji-san" Buffet lunch and shopping (60 minutes) ↓ Shibazakura Festival at Lake Motosu (80 minutes) ↓ 17:30-18:00 PM Tour Ends in Shinjuku This tour is provided by YOKOSO Japan Tour Check the Tour Conditions link below. http://voyag.in/2diT9k2
strTitle: Enjoy Foods, Great Views, Shibazakura around Mt. Fuji!

strIntroduction: Our organization (Japan Onsen Culture Association) consists of qualified onsen enthusiasts and researchers. We have a list of onsen recommendations form our real experiences for you if you feel lost about where to have hot spring experience. We have compiled a preliminary list of some of the most famous, top-notch Japanese onsen in the country. Please tell us what way you feel like soaking and we will suggest the perfect place for you to go. Most of the hot springs do not allow people with tattoos and wearing swimsuits. It can be hard even for locals to find such places. However, through our concierge service, we will be able to find the best onsen for you to enjoy in Japan. Japan is a county rich in hot springs with medical effects. The effects of hot springs are divided roughly into three effects: for the skin such as cuts, slashes, burns, chronic skin diseases; for blood flow and blood pressure such as arteriosclerosis and hypertension; and for the benefit of women with menstrual disorders and chronic women's diseases. Note: If you are serious bad condition, please contact your local doctor. Don't miss this opportunity to try the best Japanese onsen hot springs!. ※ Price Includes ※ This price includes our service fee. The price does not include the cost of your onsen - you must pay for your entrance fee at the onsen. Service Fee = $40 (USD) Our Service Fee: The amount of our service fee reflects our continuous and persistent efforts to secure places in your preferred onsen. Example Booking: We charge you the same price for individual and group. Reservation: A day tip onsen bath does not need reservation. Once you arrive at the onsen, you pay the entrance fee (typical day trip onsen SPA costs around 1000-2500 JPY with all amenities such as towel, soap, shampoo, room wear, etc). If you need to reserve a private onsen bath, or onsen accommodation, please contact our onsen reservation service.
strTitle: Enjoy Professional Onsen (Hot Spring) Concierge Service

strIntroduction: If you venture outside of Tokyo to explore Ibaraki, you'll discover the vast amount of views that Japan has to offer. This time around, you can explore Hitachi Seaside Park (Hitachi Kaihin Koen). If you've been to the Ashikaga Flower Park, you already know the spectacular views that flowers can produce. At Hitachi, that also remains true. During spring, Hitach Seaside Park displays one million plants consisting of 600+ types. As you view the gem-like area and smell your surroundings, you may believe you're in a fairy tail. One of the highlights to catch is the blooming of plants, in which the sun pours out its light to create an enchanted work of art. Thus, a camera is almost mandatory. As you view the 200+ variety of tulips, you'll also be able to catch the hillside, topped with a 350-year-old house. And yes, it has a grass roof. The highlight of the spring season is undoubtedly the hillside covered with thousand of azure-coloured nemophila flowers! As for the Autumn season, the hills transition from its summer green, emerald-like color to the crimson of the kochia bushes, which complements the ocean and sky. And with flowers ranging from white, pink, and red, it's highly recommended. Quick Note: If you happen to come by during winter, you'll be excited to hear that the park hosts a variety of events, including one where you can sample food (only during the winter season). Though, keep in mind that the ice tulips won't be seen this winter. We're excited to have you join us. Now let's embark on this journey together! In this activity you can book round-trip transportation from Tokyo to Hitachi Seaside Park by bus and explore the vast area of the park as much as you want!
strTitle: Capture the Beauty of Seasonal Flowers, Hitachi Kaihin Park
