Medium taxi – Kansai International Airport to Osaka Approximate guide to the numbers of passengers and pieces of baggage: 4 + 3 or 5 + 2 (Estimated baggage weight: Suitcase 90L) 3. Large taxi – Kansai International Airport to Osaka Approximate guide to the numbers of passengers and pieces of baggage: 9 + 9 (Estimated baggage weight: Suitcase 90L) 4. Small taxi – Osaka to Kansai International Airport Approximate guide to the numbers of passengers and pieces of baggage: 3 + 2 (Estimated baggage weight: Suitcase 90L) 5. Medium taxi – Osaka to Kansai International Airport Approximate guide to the numbers of passengers and pieces of baggage: 4 + 3 or 5 + 2 (Estimated baggage weight: Suitcase 90L) 6. Large taxi – Osaka to Kansai International Airport Approximate guide to the numbers of passengers and pieces of baggage: 9 + 9 (Estimated baggage weight: Suitcase 90L)
strTitle: Enjoy Airport Transfer to/from Kansai Airport by car, Osaka!

strIntroduction: We'll meet in the morning, at Nagoya Station, in front of Golden clock (it's a famous meeting point). We will head to Tokoname by train, it takes about 30 minutes. We will walk around the historical pottery town and have a pottery experience for an hour. You can design and make your own pottery masterpiece. Then we will eat lunch after the pottery experience. Since there are many restaurants, your can either follow my recommendation or choose whatever you want to eat. Explore the town by walking narrow paths. You'll see many interesting pottery arts like on the pictures. As we walk, we will pass through many coffee shops, souvenir shops and galleries. Feel free to stop by and see/buy the pottery arts you like!
strTitle: Experience pottery-making and tour a historical pottery town

strIntroduction: We offer cooking lessons for 2 hours at out brand new cozy kitchen studio with a big terrace next to Tsukiji Fish market, Tokyo. We welcome both groups and individuals. Meet at the kitchen where professional chef/instructor demonstrate and cook dishes of the day (3 dishes, one main dish, sushi and soup most of the time) with you. No cooking experience needed and English speaking assistants will always assist you! Attendees cook for about 1 hour, and then we can all enjoy wonderful Japanese dishes together. We welcome vegetarians and people on special diets, and with food allergies. Please consult us in advance. We are happy to organize special dishes for you!
strTitle: Experience Japanese homestyle cooking lesson in Tokyo

strIntroduction: In this experience you can go to rural Kyoto and experience Japanese traditional cuisine and hot springs in a lovely environment! Meet at Kyoto Station at 9:00 in the morning and take the local train to Kameoka. The inn bus will pick us up at Kameoka station. it's about 15 minutes drive to the inn. Enjoy the rural landscape from the bus window. Just relax and enjoy onsen hot springs until lunch time. The inn provides not only indoor hot spring, but also open-air hot spring baths. Feel fresh air while soaking in the hot spring bath. Towel, soap and shampoo are provided, so you don't need to bring any. Have lunch at the restaurant in the inn. We offer Japanese style full-course multi-dish lunch. It is full of seasonal specialties of the Kyoto region. Spend free time at the salon or souvenir shop in the inn or stroll the streets of the rural village around the inn. You will have about one hour of free time after lunch. Get back to Kyoto station around 4:00 pm where the experience ends.
strTitle: Embark on a One Day Onsen and Japanese Cuisine Tour, Kyoto

strIntroduction: The Magose-toge Pass is a very popular site on the Iseji Route of Kumano Kodo pilgrimage road in southern Mi prefecture since it is relatively easy to cross. Its stone paved path and forest of hinoki (Japanese cypress) are definitely worth seeing because they are said to be the most beautiful part of the Kumano Kodo road. In this activity you will cross the pass together with a skilled local guide. Walking route: approximately 5 km (approximately 3 hours on foot) Maximum Elevations: 135 meters The schedule is below: 09:30 Onigajou Parking ↓ Take the bus Matsumoto-toge Pass ↓ Observatory ↓ Fuefuki bridge ↓ Kinan tour design center ↓ Honcho-dori ↓ Shishi iwa rock ↓ Shichiri mihama ↓ Hanano Iwaya Shrine (UNESCO World Heritage Site) ↓ Otsuna chaya ↓ Hanano Iwaya bus stop ↓ Take the bus 14:30 Onigajou Parking (End of tour) *Only on Saturdays, Sundays and Public holidays: 11:13 Starting at JR Kumanoshi Station 16:13 Ending at Hanano Iwaya bus stop
strTitle: Walk Through the Kumano Kodo and Hanano Iwaya, Mie

strIntroduction: Want to let out your creative urges while in Japan? Then this experience is a fantastic one for you. Located in Tokoname city in Aichi prefecture, which is part of Japan’s Tokai Region, here is a chance to get your hands really dirty with a fantastic pottery experience. There are many things that you can make here and every one of them will be a memorable experience and treasure for you to take home! Cups, plates, tea cups, mugs and others, all are daily use items that will be fun to mold with your own hands and work into your own person work of art. And, while your leisurely sunbathing experience may be forgotten when you return home, drinking everyday from the mug you made in Tokoname will keep you connected forever to your precious time in Japan. What better way to keep you refreshed and stay connected to see of the happiest times of your life!
strTitle: Try Pottery Making in Tokoname City, Aichi Prefecture

strIntroduction: Hikone Castle, is located in Hikone, Shiga prefecture, Kansai, close to Osaka and Kyoto. The Castle is also located very close to Lake Biwa, Japan’s largest freshwater lake, and the home to an International Association of Athletics Federations (IAAF) prestigious Gold Label Marathon. Hikone Castle itself is 1 of only 5 castles in Japan registered as National treasures and 1 of only 12 with its original keep. That’s because in 1868, when the Meiji Era (1868-1912) began any castles were dismantled. Hikone Castle was saved from demolition at the request of none-other than the emperor! On this experience you will enjoy the amazing experience of riding a traditional Japanese canalboat through the historic moat around the castle. A fun experience for all ages, from children to adults, the views and experience of the castle will be unlike any you will experience from dry land. General Availability: Tour starts on the hour. Weekdays: 10:00-15:00 Saturday/Sunday/Public Holidays 10:00-16:00
strTitle: Enjoy A Boat Ride Along the Moat of Hikone Castle, Shiga

strIntroduction: If you arrive in Tokyo and want to try scuba diving but have no time to go to the Okinawa islands, then this experience is ideal for you! You can easily dive in the sea near Jogasaki Coast in Izu Peninsula, just two hours away by train from Tokyo! In this activity you do not need to have a special diving license because a skilled instructor will dive with you. In addition, you will be instructed in details about scuba diving, so you can join even if this is your first time. You will learn not only how to dive, but also how to communicate with other people underwater. There is plenty of wonderful sealife to be discovered near Jogasaki Coast and the instructor will take many photos of you underwater. Later, you will receive the photos on a CD as a present! Below is the schedule for this activity: 9:10 am: Get picked up from Jogasaki-Kaigan Station on Izu Kyuko Line. Do not be late for the meeting and take a train that arrives at Jogasaki-Kaigan Station exactly at 9:10 am. 10:00 am: You will be asked a few questions about your health condition and will watch a DVD with instructions about diving. 10:10 am: You will change to your swimsuit and will prepare to enter the sea 11:00 am: First, you will try snorkeling with your instructor who will show you some of the beautiful fish species that can be seen around Jogasaki Coast 12:00 pm: The real diving experience starts! Discover the full beauty of the sealife near Izu Peninsula! 13:00 pm: End of the diving. Change your clothes and wait a few minutes until the CD with your underwater photos is ready. Note: Adults and children over the age of 10 and in good health can participate in this activity.
strTitle: Dive with an instructor in the sea near Jogasaki Coast, Izu

strIntroduction: In this activity in Hida-Furukawa, Gifu prefecture, you will have visit a local artisan's atelier and will have the chance to try hand-weaving on a traditional Japanese loom. You will make your own striped tablecloth with the assistance of the skilled local artisan. Alternatively, you can try dying fabric using local organic dyes. In addition to this craft experience you will learn how organic dyes were used as herbs and even as food products in the past when Japanese people believed that they protect the body from various diseases. The atelier also offers plenty of woven items for sale. Enjoy the traditions of Hida-Furukawa located just a few minutes away by train from Takayama city!
strTitle: Try hand-weaving and painting with organic dyes in Furukawa

strIntroduction: Takaoka city in Toyama prefecture is well-known for its traditional crafts. The city flourished during the Edo period under the rule of the Maeda clan and many craftsmen as well as merchants helped for elevating Takaoka's status within the feudal domain. Particularly the city's copperware and lacquerware industry are still among Japan's very best ones. Takaoka's copperware traditions date back to 1611 when the feudal lord Maeda Toshinaga invited several prominent craftsmen to the city. Today various molds are used for casting metal and producing high-quality kitchen utensils. The famous Giant Buddha of Takaoka is another great example of the local craft technqiues. Takaoka's lacquerware traditions originated in 1609 when Maeda Toshinaga imported Chinese techniques of decoration in the city. Today there are various types of lacquerware, among which the mother-of-pearl inlay using the inside part of abalone shells is particular popular. In this activity you will go to a local craftsman shop and choose between making your own tin sake cup or decorating a bento box with mother-of-pearl inlay. Details about the activities: 1. Tin sake cup making You will create the mold and cast tin into it, after which you will polish the sake cup. At the end of the activity you can take the sake cup with you! This activity takes about 2 hours. 2. Mother-of-pearl inlay You will have the opportunity to decorate either a small bento box (onigiri-size) or the back of a hand-mirror with mother-of-pearl inlay. Please think in advance of a pattern that you would like to create. The staff at the shop will have to complete your work and it will take about 2 weeks to 1 month until it is ready to be shipped. Please note that you will have to pay shipping fee if you would like to receive the item. This activity takes about 1 hour. Discover the traditions of Takaoka's crafts with local craft masters!
strTitle: Create your own copperware and lacquerware items in Takaoka!

strIntroduction: In this guided experience you will visit Japan's largest and most attractive wasabi farm located in Azumino city in Nagano prefecture, not far from Matsumoto city. Daio Wasabi Farm was opened in 1917 and nowadays attracts many visitors who want to learn more about the distinctive culture of growing wasabi plants or just want to experience a pleasant stroll in open nature. The farm has many walking trails among the wasabi fields which are constantly irrigated by small streams of fresh, clean mountain water. In addition, you can see attractive facilities such as a water mill, a local shrine, wasabi factories and more. The view of the Northern Alps in the background will make this guided walk an unforgettable trip to Nagano's nature. At the end of the walk you will have the chance to make your own pickled wasabi souvenirs. In a 20-minute cooking class you will make two little boxes of the valuable food that you can take home with you. Please note that the pickled wasabi you make needs to be stored in a refrigerator for at least several days before becoming ready for consumption. You can buy more pickled wasabi ready for consumption at the shop in the farm. Enjoy your short side trip to Daio Wasabi Farm in Nagano!
strTitle: Make your own pickled wasabi at Japan's largest wasabi farm!

strIntroduction: In this tour you will visit Shima city in Mie prefecture and discover the fascinating ancient culture of the Japanese female divers Ama. You will have the opportunity to immerse yourself completely in the realm of Ama divers and Mie's pearl cultivation. Find unique aspects of the Japanese traditional local culture by experiencing what we have on offer for you! Below is the itinerary of the tour: Day 1: Late afternoon: Take a taxi or a direct boat from Kashikojima Station to Wagu port where you will be picked up to go Pearl Gourmet Inn Takesho hotel for check-in. A mini-van will take you to a nearby Ama female diver hut where you will have seafood dinner in a traditional atmosphere. The Ama divers will cook the dinner on the sunken fireplace in front of you! Note: The transportation to the hotel is not included in the price. Day 2: Meet your guide. From 6:30 am before breakfast you will visit the local seafood market and observe the lifestyle of local fishermen who have just brought fresh catch of the famous Ise lobsters. After this interesting fish market visit you will return to Pearl Gourmet Inn Takesho for breakfast and then ride on a boat to observe the actual daily activities of Ama female divers in the open sea! This is a very rare opportunity to see Ama divers doing their actual job and the activity is not set up specially for tourists. In case of bad weather, the boat ride will be substituted by a walk with Ama divers around the rural village. Return to the hotel to make your own pearl accessories! The tour ends after you create your souvenir. Discover the rich cultural heritage of the Ama female divers in this unique tour to Shima city in Mie prefecture! Note: This tour is available mainly in March-April, but may be offered later as well. Please contact us about availability. Please book at least one week in advance!
strTitle: See Ama female divers working in the sea, a rare tour in Mie

strIntroduction: This is a tour which will give you the chance to experience the traditional pilgrimage to the holy Ise Jingu shrines in Mie prefecture - the most venerated sanctuary of Shinto. You will have the opportunity to participate in ancient rituals and purification ceremonies before visiting the shrines and praying for good luck. Finally, you will be able to stroll the shopping streets of Oharaimachi, the busy district in front of Naiku (Kotaijingu, the Inner Shrine), and eat a lunch with a religious symbolism. Below is the itinerary of this tour: Day 1: Early evening: Arrive at Futamigaura (Futaminoura Station) and check in a traditional-style ryokan inn with a hot spring. Have dinner and go to bed early because the activities on the next morning start from sunrise. Note: Transportation to Futaminoura Station is not included. Day 2: Sunrise time - Take part in the traditional body and soul purification ceremony "Misogi" that is part of the Shinto rituals before visiting the sacred Ise Jingu. You will bathe in the ocean near Futami Okitama Shrine with the first rays of the rising sun and cleanse your mind and heart from all earthly sins. IMPORTANT! The "Misogi" ceremony is conducted only on the morning following the 3rd Saturday of the month (excluding December to March). On all other days you will sit the indoor purification ritual "Muku-Shiobarai" where a Shinto priest will wave a special stick with dried green algae over you. This ritual starts around 10:00 am. Before you leave Futamigaura, take a look at the sacred "Meoto Iwa" rocks known as the "wedded rocks" because they are connected by the Shinto shimenawa straw rope. Before noon - Take the local bus together with your guide and go first to Geku (Toyoue-Daijingu, the Ise Outer Shrine), then to Naiku (Kotaijingu, the Ise Inner Shrine). The legendary Ise Jingu shrines have been a final destinations for thousands of pilgrims during the Edo period, and it is still believed that every person should visit Ise at least once in their life. Afternoon - Stroll the Oharaimachi street in front of Naiku and have lunch with local delicacies (seafood or Ise udon noodles). The meal eaten after a visit to the shrines is called "Naorai" and also has a special religious significance. Buy souvenirs such as the traditional Ise sweets with red bean paste "Akafuku" and leave by bus for Uji-Yamada Station where the tour ends. Note: Please note that the Shinto rituals have a genuine religious value and are not a touristic attraction. You are expected to participate in the ceremonies in an earnest way with a sincere heart. Your guide will explain more about the correct conduct during the rituals.
strTitle: Purify your soul with sea water & visit the holy Ise Jingu

strIntroduction: Ago Bay in Shima City, Mie prefecture, is known for its picturesque beauty and mild climate making it the perfect place to experience outdoor water activities. We shall provide you with a kayak short course (1.5 hours) where you can paddle across the bay to see the different uninhabited islands. Afterwards, you can enjoy playing inside a water ball. This is a unique activity wherein you will be placed inside a ball that is floating in the bay. The ball is transparent so you will get a chance to see underwater. Both experiences will surely bring the fun and enjoyment to you during your visit in this area! Tag along your family and friends! Note: This experience is offered for adults children over the age of 3. In summer the activity might be held only in the evening due to hot weather. You can access the facility (Shima Shizen Gakko) by taxi from Kashikojima Station in Shima city.
strTitle: Enjoy Kayak and Waterball fun in Ago bay, Shima city, Mie

strIntroduction: Ninjutsu is the traditional art used by ninjas during the feudal eras of Japan. Now practiced for centuries, this martial art uses techniques such as stealth, camouflage and sabotage. This activity is a one-day course designed for you to learn the basic concepts of ninjutsu. It is held in Iga Ueno city, Mie prefecture, where the famous Iga-ryu ninja clan originated! The program of this activity is as follows: 10:00 Start of training 10:00 to 10:15 Change to ninja outfit 10:15 to 10:45 Praying ritual at the shrine 10:45 to 12:00 Physical and spiritual training 12:00 to 13:00 Lunch 13:00 to 15:45 Continuation of training (learn how to use weapons, tools, fire, how to hide and more!) 15:45 to 15:50 Awarding with certificates of completion of ninja training 15:50 to 16:00 Change of clothes and end of activity Please take note that aside from the training fee, a ninja outfit rental fee of 1,080 JPY is also required. Optional lunch is also available: Suehiro Sushi - 1,200 JPY Set Lunch - 3,000 JPY The required ninja outfit rental fee and optional lunch fee must be paid at the venue during the activity.
strTitle: Join a 1-day ninja training course for beginners at Iga Ueno

strIntroduction: Kamaboko is a type of fishcake made of grounded white fishes. It has been around in Japan since the 12th century and was used as a gift for festive occasions such as weddings. Nowadays Kamaboko is a common dish in the Japanese cuisine. You will have the chance to make three types of traditional Kamaboko in a one of the country's leading fishcake factories in Tsuruga city, Fukui prefecture: Grilled Kamaboko, Plated Kamaboko, and Crafted Kamaboko. (Please note that the menu can change depending on season). Don’t worry if you have no knowledge about Kamaboko - the professionals will guide you step by step. This activity is recommended to everyone from kids to adults. Fukui prefecture is located along Japan Sea around three hours away from Tokyo, and an hour and half away from Osaka. It is known for its delicious seafood and sake. Your handmade Kamaboko will go perfectly with the local sake! Also, enjoy the beautiful nature of Tsuruga!
strTitle: Learn how to make Kamaboko from a professional in Fukui

strIntroduction: Strawberries are one of the most popular fruits in Japan. There are different types of strawberries. Each has its unique sweetness and taste. At Lake Shorenji in Mie prefecture, you can try strawberry picking and eat as many strawberries as you want! The following types of strawberries are grown in the farm: Akihime - a variety known for each softness and sweet taste Nyohou (women's peak) - sweet and high in acidity Kurenai hoppe (red cheeks) - firm and very sweet Kaorino - have a very sweet and strong scent Why not enjoy picking and eating these different types of strawberries at Lake Shorenji with your family and friends! Note: This activity is available from January 3 to May 31, from 9:30 am to 16:00 pm every day. The farm is located in Nabari city in Mie prefecture. Get off at Nabari Station (of Kintetsu Osaka line) and take a bus from the east exit bound for "Yurigaoka". Get off at "Yurigaoka" and walk 2 minutes until "Yamayuri annaijo" where the farm is located.
strTitle: Pick and eat strawberries at a farm near Lake Shorenji, Mie

strIntroduction: In this highly recommended experience during winter and spring, you will get a chance to pick fresh strawberries which you can enjoy eating as much as you want for 40 minutes. Different types of strawberries are found in the farm - each has its unique sweetness and taste. Why not try it out and experience this activity with your family or friends? As an add-on option, you can soak in the Kataoka Onsen hot spring located in same facility with the strawberry farm. What better way to relax after a hard day's work of strawberry picking and eating! Note: Strawberry picking is available from 10 am to 16 pm, from December until May. The facility is located along Kintetsu Yunoyama Line in Mie prefecture. The nearest station is Yunoyama Onsen Station from where you can take a bus bound to "Aqua Ignis" or walk back for about 8 minutes. There are also direct buses from Nagoya's Meitetsu Bus Center (morning departure only).
strTitle: Pick strawberries at a strawberry farm in North Ise, Mie

strIntroduction: Have you ever heard of Shamisen? Shamisen is a 3-string traditional musical instrument in Japan.  It is also an important part of Japanese culture. You can see it in Kabuki, you can see it when a Geisha sings, you can even see it in a Rock Band! Its sound is strong and clear, and has a really high expression of different kinds of emotions. Would you like to try playing Shamisen? Shamisen looks so cool and incredible, but in fact, it's not difficult for beginners at all! You can learn to play a simple song in 1 or 2 hours! When you come to Sensoji Temple in Asakusa, why not stay for 1 or 2 hours longer to learn more about real Japanese culture from a real professional Shamisen player! The flow of the experience: 1. Please send us a message to check the time, we will contact you in 24 hours. 2. After the time is decided, we will send you the address and how to come to the place. 3. Please come on time. It's not necessary to bring anything, just bring a camera maybe. 4. Enjoy playing Shamisen! At the end of the lesson, you can play the song by yourself, and we can take a small video for you with your camera as a memorial to your shamisen playing! Location 5 minutes walk from Sensoji Temple Time 40-60 minutes Teacher Ms. Sakada Maiko She is young, but a highly experienced professional Shamisen player. She started to learn Shamisen when she was 8, graduated from Japanese Music Major of Tokyo University of the Arts. Now she is a busy professional player, with a wide range of performance experience, on stages, at Imperial palace, for foreigners, etc. She is also the Shamisen player of the traditional music performance group, Ayane. Assistant Kawamura (Ms.), a pupil of Ms. Sakada. She manages the reservations. Here is what she says about Ms. Sakada: "I was really lucky that I found Ms. Sakada! There is no need to say how good she is on Shamisen, and what's more than that, she is really an elegant and patient teacher! I totally can assure you will have a nice experience learning with her! Ms. Sakada speaks Japanese and some English, I will help to do some translation when necessary. And I can tell you a little secret! In fact some of Ms. Sakada's pupils are real Geisha. If you are lucky enough, you can meet a Geisha in their day life. They are really busy during daytime, practice Shamisen, practice singing, practice dancing, practice small drums, tea ceremony, choose Kimono... I was so surprised to meet a Geisha when she was practicing Shamisen at Ms. Sakada's place!" Looking forward to meeting you! Let's play Shamisen together!
strTitle: Play Shamisen with a professional in Asakusa!
Visit the Peace Memorial in a Okinawa Private Car Tour

strIntroduction: Have you come accross a product that is not sold in your country but saw a great opportunity to market? During your trip in Japan, did you see a property that you wanted to purchase? Did you think you wanted to study in Japan and perhaps continue to stay and work? If any of above rang your bell, contact us while in Osaka for a comprehensive session of business consultation and legal advice! You might have seen the temples, shrines, and palaces but we know that is not all what you wanted to do. Before you fly out, we can help you to make your next trip to Japan something more than a sight-seeing. A team of experts is going to see you at your hotel. We can move to a nearest cafe, co-working space or even at the foyer of your hotel to do a 2-hr meeting. Your questions will be answered and we will provide you with all the necessary information and can eventually set up a brief business plan. The team is with an international marketing consultant who has been a great business development manager for various overseas clients. Some of the customers are: educational institute, handicrafts manufacture, importer of auto parts, property management office. Also equipped with Administrative Scrivener which is a Japan national qualification. It is best translated as Administrative Lawyer. A professional of any legal requirement, would perfectly know what is allowed and what is not. The consultant has been helping a great number of international students and expats to acquire a legal status in Japan.
strTitle: Receive Business Consultation & Legal Advice in Osaka

strIntroduction: Yamanashi prefecture is the ideal place for a day trip as it provides travelers with a wealth of cultural experience in rural Japan and a beautiful view of Mt. Fuji. This 8-hour private car tour will take you from Hakone to Lake Kawaguchi and Yamanashi. Enjoy the scenery from the view point of Lake Kawaguchi, pick fruits in Fuefuki City and visit a winery in Yamanashi City! The first destination from Hakone is a view point of Lake Kawaguchi. The lake is located in the southern part of Yamanashi prefecture near Mt. Fuji and is the second largest of the Fuji Five Lakes in terms of surface area. The area around the lake is a famous resort because of its beautiful views of Mt. Fuji and is a place where you can enjoy various activities such as windsurfing, camping, and excursion boating. And of course you will have spectacular views of Mt. Fuji. The second destination is an orchard in Fuefuki City which offers you a fruit picking experience. Yamanashi prefecture is well known as Japan’s "Fruit Kingdom" and produces high quality fruits such as grape, peach, strawberry and cherry. The fruits you will pick change depending on the season (strawberry/peach/grape) and you can eat the fruits as much as possible within a time limit (usually around 30 minutes). The last place to visit is a winery in Yamanashi city. You might think "Is there a winery in Japan?". But the history of wine making started here in the 19th century, and Yamanashi prefecture accounts for 40% of Japan’s domestic production. So you will definitely enjoy visiting a winery and also tasting some Japanese high-quality wine. We offer 9 price settings depending on the number of people in your group. Outlines are written in the pricing table. Included: - Private car with fuel and driver - Entrance fee of an orchard and a winery Duration: - 8 hours
strTitle: Enjoy a Private Car Yamanashi Day Tour from Hakone!

strIntroduction: Located in Ise-Shima National Park, the sea and islands in Toba are deep in the local lifestyle. There is a model factory and a pearl museum on the island, and visitors can even watch the processing of pearls, as well as observe how women divers, known as Ama, collect pearls as a performance show. The Ama can be seen actively at work collecting abalone and seaweed. Throughout the area scattered restaurants serve extremely fresh seafood. Join a kayak tour to explore the beauty of Ise-Shima National Park. For food hunters, take a bite of local cuisine and have lunch on the tour! Interested in Japanese culture? Meet Ama’s in their hut and enjoy fresh grilled seafood made by them. You can choose among 6 different plans outlined below! 1. Spiritual tour visiting Ama-san Enjoy the experience praying to Ishigami-san who can make your wish come true, enjoy an Ama hut experience, etc, amidst Toba nature, culture, and even a festival for a variety of different experiences. 3.5 hours Including lunch in an Ama hut All seasons (except August 13 – 15 and December 30 – January 10) 2. Ise Lobster Cooking Class Served with one live lobster, make a delicious lobster dish, miso soup, sashimi, etc. easily! 2.5 hours (10:30 to 13:00) September 16 – April 30 3. Desert Island Exploring for adults Ukishima island is one of the desert islands in Toba Bay. Explore the island, enjoy snorkeling and fishing, and eat onigiri made using the kuronori (black seaweed) of Toba Bay! 4 hours (9:00 to 13:00) Mid July – Late August 4. Desert Island Exploring for child Ukishima island is one of the desert islands in Toba Bay. Explore the island, enjoy snorkeling and fishing, and eat onigiri made using the kuronori (black seaweed) of Toba Bay! 4 hours (9:00 to 13:00) Mid July – Late August 5. Under a Starry Night! Clear Kayaking Tour In the clear kayak, you will paddle out to fantastic waves. You will see the lights from sea creatures sparkling from beneath your kayak. Move slowly and relax. Enjoy the mysterious lights of sea fireflies. 1.5 hours (20:00 to 21:30) June – Beginning of September (Only Friday, Saturday, and Sunday) 6. Under a Starry Night! Clear Kayaking Tour for family In the clear kayak, you will paddle out fantastic waves. You will see the lights from sea creatures sparkling from beneath your kayak. Move slowly and relax. Enjoy the mysterious lights of sea fireflies. 1.5 hours (20:00 to 21:30) Total weight under 170 kg June – Beginning of September (Only Friday, Saturday, and Sunday)
strTitle: Enjoy the eco-tours in Toba city, Mie!

strIntroduction: We run a theme bar offering "Magic and owarai comedy" shows in Ikebukuro, Tokyo. In particular, we provide an experience called "Magic and Entertainment show with free drinks(*) for 2 hours" The flow for this experience is below. 1. Please come to our bar at the booked time (we will be glad if you come 5 minutes earlier). 2. You can enjoy a table magic show (our magician comes to your table for 10 minutes during the 2 hours), and stage show (with magic tricks and comedy gigs). 3. This activity takes 2 hours. You cannot stay longer than 2 hours. (*) free drinks: this means you can select one drink from our menu, if you finish itm you can select another one during the 2 hours. We can speak English, Chinese, Korean. If you have any question, please don't hesitate to ask us. If you want to order our foods and drinks from the menu (except for the free drinks), you need to pay additionally.
strTitle: Enjoy a Magic and Comedy show in a bar in Ikebukuro, Tokyo

strIntroduction: Aichi prefecture is known as the cradle of Japan's industrialization and technological innovation. It is no wonder that the World Expo in 2005 was held exactly in Aichi. Japan's leading automobile company Toyota originated in Aichi as a producer of machine-powered looms. However, the prefecture's traditions in manufacture date back to the 10th century, when Japan's most popular ceramics were developed in Seto city. Today Seto and Tokoname cities are famous for their top-class pottery and porcelain products, while numerous high-tech companies starting with Toyota have their main factory plants near the Ise Bay. In this cultural and educational one day guided trip from Nagoya you will visit Seto and Toyota cities to discover the historical development of Japanese manufacture throughout the centuries. You will have the chance to paint your own ceramic art, eat the delicious local eel rice bowl and then go to Toyota Kaikan Museum, where top examples of leading innovations in the automobile sector are exhibited. Below is the itinerary of this tour: 10:00 am: Meet your guide at Sakaemachi Station and take the Meitetsu train for Owari-Seto (about 40 minutes). 10:40 am: Arrive at Seto city and explore the pleasant townscape on foot. Numerous little shops and craftsman ateliers are lined up along the river that runs through the city. You will visit the fascinating "Setogura Museum" and learn the old history of Seto city and its ceramic art in real-size replicas of the city's old ateliers and kilns. Next, you will go to Shinseiki Kogeikan, another museum where top-class porcelain art work is displayed. Finally, go to Japan's unique Maneki-neko Museum and learn more about the habits of placing the cat figurines at the front of stores in order to invite prosperity and clients. Here you can paint your own art figurine! After this activity you can taste the local specialty - eel rice bowl - for lunch. 13:30 pm: Take the train from Owari-Seto to Mikawa-Toyota (about 50 minutes). Walk for about 20 minutes to Toyota Kaikan Museum or take a taxi for a short 5-minute ride. 14:00 pm: Explore the wonderful Toyota Kaikan Museum where plenty of examples of Toyota's leading automobile technologies are displayed. You can see not only famous past models, but also latest innovations in the automobile industry related to EV cars, fuel-cell batteries and eco-friendly technologies. 15:15 pm: Return back to Mikawa-Toyota Station where the tour ends. Discover the historical development of Aichi prefecture's industrial products in this educational one day trip from Nagoya!
strTitle: Discover Aichi's traditional porcelain and Toyota's industry

strIntroduction: Lake Hamanako is one of Japan's largest lakes located in the westernmost part of Shizuoka prefecture, near Hamamatsu city. The city is conveniently located close to Nagoya and can be reached by Shinkansen bullet train in about 40 minutes. Lake Hamanako used to be a fresh-water lake, but became connected to the Pacific Ocean in the 15th century after an earthquake. Nowadays the wide area consists of a pleasant hot spring town (Kanzanji Onsen), restaurant and shopping facilities, an amusement park, a flower park and a zoo. There are plenty of things to do and enjoy around Lake Hamanako which makes it ideal as a destination for a one-day trip from Nagoya. Here you can enjoy strolling in beautiful parks, sail over the lake in a pleasant cruise, relax in an open-air hot spring, view the area from an observatory on a top of a mountain, and much more! Enjoy a wonderful adventure in the wide open nature of Lake Hamanako for a day! Below is the schedule for this guided tour: 10:30 am: Take the Shinkansen bullet train from Nagoya to Hamamatsu city (about 40 minutes). Arrive at Hamamatsu Station and meet your guide. 11:30 am: Take the local bus from Hamamatsu bus terminal to Hamamatsu Flower Park (about 40 minutes). Enjoy strolling the beautiful gardens of the flower park and eat lunch at a local cafe. You can also buy flower-themed souvenirs here. 13:45 pm: Walk to the pier and take the Lake Hamanako sightseeing cruise for a one hour pleasant sail to the opposite side of the lake. You will see plenty of seagulls and the nearby facilities among which are the amusement park PalPal and the Tomei Highway which crosses the lake from above. 14:50 pm: Arrive at Kanzanji Onsen and go to a nearby resort hotel for a unique hot spring experience. You will be able to relax in an open-air pool on the top of the building (for men) or a large indoor pool with a splendid panorama view over the entire lake (for women). 16:00 pm: Walk to the Kanzanji Ropeway and ride the gondola over the lake to the observatory on top of the small Mt Okusayama. From here you can see a breath-taking view over Lake Hamanako. 16:30 pm: Return to Kanzanji Onsen and take the bus back to Hamamatsu Station where the tour ends. Feel the free spirit of the wide open nature and enjoy your day trip to Lake Hamanako to the fullest!
strTitle: Feel free-spirited in a day trip to the wide Lake Hamanako!

strIntroduction: In May 2016 Mie prefecture in Central Japan will host the next G7 Summit. The main venue of the event will be on Kashikojima island in the scenic Ago Bay, the homeland of Mie's pearl cultivation culture. The history of Mie's pearls began in 1893 when the local entrepreneur Mikomoto Kokichi succeeded in cultivating pearls for the first time in Japan, but the origins of Ise-Shima region's fishing culture can be traced back to the 2000-year-old traditions of the female divers Ama. Dressed only in white clothes and without any air tanks, the Ama divers have been sustaining the lives of local people in Ise-Shima region for centuries with their skillful techniques of collecting seafood. After the pearl cultivation in Mie began, the female divers helped for collecting oysters and boosted the development of the local industry. Nowadays Mikimoto-branded pearls are famous worldwide, while the Ama divers still preserve their traditional culture and distinctive lifestyle. In this cultural and educational 2-day 1-night trip you will visit Ise-Shima area and immerse yourself completely in the realm of Ama divers and Mie's pearl cultivation. You will be fascinated to discover not only beautiful scenery around the splendid Ago Bay, but also an ingenuous local culture that characterizes the entire region. At the end of this trip you will understand why Japan chose exactly this location as the venue for the next G7 Summit in 2016. Below is the itinerary of this tour. You can choose between two different seasonal options for the end of Day 1 and Day 2: Day 1 (self-guided) 9:10 (recommended starting time) - Take the limited express train from Kintetsu Nagoya Station to Toba Station (about 100 minutes). 10:48 - Arrive at Toba and go directly to Mikimoto Pearl Museum. Watch a live Ama diving performance from the observation deck and learn more about the history of pearl cultivation in Mie. 12:00 - Have lunch with fresh seafood in one of the restaurants near Mikimoto Pearl Island 12:29 - Take the Kintetsu line train from Toba Station to the final Kashikojima Station (about 40 minutes by local train or 30 minutes by limited express train). 13:30 - Ride on the sightseeing cruise "Esperanza" along the island-dotted Ago Bay! The Spanish-style galley boat will also take you to a model pearl factory where you will observe the process of creating pearls from oysters. 14:30 - Return to Kashikojima port. From here you can choose between the main two options of this trip: Option 1 (Available mainly from mid March to end of April; please ask about availability after April): Take a taxi to Pearl Gourmet Inn Takesho hotel, or a boat from Kashikojima to Wagu port where you will be picked up, and check-in. A mini-van will take you to a nearby Ama female diver hut where you will have seafood dinner in a traditional atmosphere. The Ama divers will cook the dinner on the sunken fireplace in front of you! Option 2 (Available all year round): Take a taxi to Haifu Onsen Hotel and spend a relaxing evening in a room with private hot spring on the balcony overlooking the bay. Day 2 (guided): Option 1 (Available mainly from mid March to end of April): Meet your guide. From 6:30 am before breakfast you will visit the local seafood market and observe the lifestyle of local fishermen who have just brought fresh catch of the famous Ise lobsters. After this interesting fish market visit you will return to Pearl Gourmet Inn Takesho for breakfast and then ride on a boat to observe the actual daily activities of Ama female divers in the open sea! This is a very rare opportunity to see Ama divers doing their actual job and the activity is not set up specially for tourists. In case of bad weather, the boat ride will be substituted by a walk with Ama divers around the rural village. Return to the hotel to make your own pearl accessories! After you make your own souvenir your trip ends a little before noon. You can explore the town on your own or return to Kashikojima with your guide. Option 2 (Available all year round): Meet your guide at the lobby of your hotel. Go to Yokoyama Observatory by taxi and enjoy the breath-taking panorama view of the entire Ago Bay. Stroll down the streets of the little town before heading towards Satoumi-an, a traditional-style Ama female divers hut where you will have seafood lunch in a traditional atmosphere and learn more about the distinctive local Ama culture. After lunch you will go to the pearl studio to make your own souvenir accessories from pearls! The tour will end at Kashikojima or Ugata Station. Enjoy the blessings of Ise-Shima's nature and the rich cultural heritage of the Ama female divers in this unique 2-day trip to Mie prefecture! Note: There will be no guide on Day 1 but you can follow the itinerary that we provide. Entrance to the Mikimoto Pearl Museum and the sightseeing cruise are included in the price. IMPORTANT: Please book this tour at least one week in advance.
strTitle: Discover the secrets of the female divers Ama & Mie's pearls

strIntroduction: This is the ultimate experience for those travelers who wish to embark on a spiritual journey to the depths of Japan's traditions and religion. In this trip you will discover the secret hideout places of the Iga clan ninja spies and try some of their body-training techniques surrounded by the beautiful nature of Akame 48 Waterfalls. Later, you will go to the sacred Ise Jingu, Japan's most venerated and important Shinto sanctuary, where you will do all the rituals and rites that pilgrims have been doing at this place for centuries. At the end of this tour to Japan's heart you will become fully aware of the spiritual significance of preserved old traditions. Embrace the spirit of Japan and purify your body and soul like the pilgrims of the old Edo period! This is a 2-day tour offered to everyone who wishes to experience Japan's traditions and culture on a deeper level. You will go to Mie prefecture and visit some of the most significant historical heritage sites in the area while participating actively in rituals related to purifying your body and soul. You will learn the ways of ninja, see beautiful mountains and sea, take part in sacred religious ceremonies, and visit the country's most venerated Shinto sanctuary, the Ise Jingu. Below is the itinerary for this tour: Day 1 8:30 - Leave Kintetsu Nagoya Station by the Kintetsu Limited Express line with your guide. 10:04 - Arrive at Akameguchi Station and go by taxi to Akame 48 Waterfalls 10:30 - Take a short guided walk around the beautiful waterfalls and the mountain trail in the forest before having lunch with beef at a local restaurant. 13:00 - Change to a rental ninja wear and participate in a fun 1.5-hour long ninja training session in the forest! The practice is not strenuous but good enough for outdoor exercising so make sure you don't overeat at lunch. You will train climbing walls, walking on ropes, throwing shuriken, shooting with bamboo sticks, hiding behind secret doors and much more! At the end of this amazing practice you will receive a certificate for a ninja apprentice! 15:00 - Leave Akame 48 Waterfalls and head to Futamigaura by trains. 17:30 - Arrive at Futamigaura and check in a traditional-style ryokan inn with a hot spring. Have dinner and go to bed early because the activities on the next morning start from sunrise. Day 2 Sunrise time - Take part in the traditional body and soul purification ceremony "misogi" that is part of the Shinto rituals before visiting the sacred Ise Jingu shrines. You will bathe in the ocean near Futami Okitama Shrine with the first rays of the rising sun and cleanse your mind and heart from all earthly sins. IMPORTANT! The "Misogi" ceremony is conducted only on morning after the 3rd Saturday of the month (excluding December to March). On all other days you will sit the indoor purification ritual "Muku-Shiobarai" where a Shinto priest will wave a special stick with dried green algae over you. This ritual starts around 10:00 am. Before you leave Futamigaura, take a look at the sacred "Meoto Iwa" rocks known as the "wedded rocks" because they are connected by the Shinto shimenawa straw rope. Before noon - Take the local bus together with your guide and go first to Geku (Outer Shrine), then to Naiku (Inner Shrine). The legendary Ise Jingu have been a final destinations for thousands of pilgrims during the Edo period, and it is still believed that every person should visit Ise at least once in their life. Afternoon - Stroll the Oharaimachi street in front of Naiku and have lunch with local delicacies (seafood or Ise udon noodles). The meal eaten after a visit to the shrines is called "Naorai" and also has a special religious significance. Buy souvenirs such as the traditional Ise sweets with red bean paste "Akafuku" and leave by bus for Uji-Yamada Station where the tour ends. Discover the true spirit of Japan with this unique cultural 1-night 2-day tour in Mie prefecture! Note: Please note that the Shinto rituals have a genuine religious value and are not a touristic attraction. You are expected to participate in the ceremonies in an earnest way with a sincere heart. Your guide will explain more about the correct conduct during the rituals.
strTitle: Train your body by ninja practice, purify your soul in Ise!

strIntroduction: The annual Sapporo Snow Festival and Otaru Snow Light Path Festival are two of the most well-known attractions of Hokkaido Region. Thus, during these occasions, booking for accommodations and activities are challenging for tourists. These hassle-free tours are designed for you to fully enjoy the festivals and at the same time, see the notable sights and taste the local delicacies of the region. The itinerary for this tour is as follows: Day 1 A pick-up service will be arranged. From New Chitose Airport, you will be transported to your hotel at Sapporo. After check-in (from 2 pm), you will be given free-time to relax or explore the area. Day 2 A day tour with private transportation (Japanese speaking driver) around Sapporo City will be provided. This tour will include the following attractions: Sapporo Clock Tower, Odori Park, Okura Ski Jump Stadium, Moiwa Observatory, Makomanai Stadium, Hitsujigaoka Observatory, and Sapporo Beer Garden. End the day with a full-course Genghis Khan dinner. The menu consists of the following items: - 4 types of Genghis Khan (raw lamb, salt, soy sauce, miso) - Japanese grilled scallop - 2 types of Hokkaido crab - fried potatoes with bacon and onion - ramen salad - sushi with salmon, salmon roe and crab - vanilla ice-cream Day 3 A day tour with private transportation (Japanese speaking driver) around Otaru City will be provided. This tour will include the following attractions: Shukutsu Panorama Observatory, Music Box Museum, Kitaichi Glass Gallery, Otaru Canal Area, Herring Mansion and Aoyama Villa. End the day with a sumptuous Hokkaido crab dinner. A-set plan: This includes a dinner with a fixed menu. You will be served 3 types of crab (hair crab, snow crab, blue king crab) together with chanchan-yaki (cooked seafood with vegetables on a hot iron plate), 3 types of sashimi, potato gratin, appetizer, salmon roe rice bowl, miso soup with crab, pickled vegetables and a dessert. Day 4 Free time and airport transfer to New Chitose Airport. What this tour includes: - Hotel accommodation for three nights with breakfast inclusions - Round-trip airport transfers - Sapporo and Otaru day tours with private transportation (Japanese speaking driver) - Full-course dinner at Genghis Khan Restaurant - Full-course crab dinner * Entrance fees to attractions are not included * Optional Add-on: English-speaking local guide * Booking must be made two (2) weeks prior to the tour *This tour package is only available from February 6 to 12
strTitle: Hokkaido's Winter Festivals in a Package Tour from Sapporo

strIntroduction: Aizu-Bandai is known for having some of the best snow in Japan. There are numerous ski resorts in the surrounding area, with "Hoshino Resort Alts Bandai" being one of the largest ski resorts in the Tohoku region. The view overlooking Lake Inawashiro is also superb. On the other side of Mt. Bandai there is also the "Urabandai Nekoma Ski Resort", one of the largest slopes where you can enjoy powder snow, so be sure to pay it a visit if you have time. The Higashiyama is the most popular hotsprings in Aizu, it has been discovered by the great monk Gyoki, 1300 years ago. We offer Higashiyama hot springs overnight stay tour from Tokyo. Staying at a casual hotel, enjoying skiing or snowboarding, and refreshing body and soul in a local hot springs will surely become a special way to spend your holidays. You can also enjoy Ouchijuku night tour as an optional add-on. Lying along Aizu West Road and nestled between mountains the small village once flourished as a post town in the Edo period. The snowy landscape with a moonlight will make your trip more romantic! The tour departs at Higashiyama hot springs around 19:20 and back to springs around 22:10. ** Ski and Snow board Bus schedule ** From Shinjuku (Depart at 11:10) To Wakamatsu (Arrive at 15:39) From Wakamatsu (Depart at 18:00) To Shinjuku (Arrive at 22:29) ** Accommodation / Japanese Style Room** ・Ski & Snow board (Double occupancy) ・Ski & Snow board (Double occupancy)+Night Tour ・Ski & Snow board (Triple occupancy) ・Ski & Snow board (Triple occupancy)+Night Tour ・Ski & Snow board (4-6 people occupancy) ・Ski & Snow board (4-6 people occupancy)+Night Tour
strTitle: Play in the snow and stay overnight in Aizu!

strIntroduction: Do you want to escape from the busy urban areas of central Tokyo and feel the natural wind? If so, why not try horse riding. The local horse riding club with its 22 strong and beautiful horses welcome you to the horse riding experience in Misato, Saitama. It is full of nature, but easily accessible from central Tokyo. Since it is a small club, they will select the best horse to suit your riding style, so there will be no worry if this is the first time that you ride on a horse. The Three Fields horse riding club is open throughout the year except Mondays, the end-of -the-year and the New Year season. (Open if the Monday is a national holiday, and will be closed on the next day) The opening hours are 9:00 – 17:00, which may be changed depending on the temperature. The trial lesson lasts 60 minutes in total. Bring your own gloves (work gloves). Comfortable clothes will be a must. If the weather is bad or unseasonable, your reservation can be changed. However, horse riding can be possible even if it rains. The number of people to be admitted to each lesson is 6. Horse riding is NOT possible if you: Are younger than 10 Are older than 70 Are pregnant Are lactating Are not feeling well Have a heart disease
strTitle: Ride on a Horse in Misato, Saitama!

strIntroduction: Bonsai are miniaturized potted plants and a popular and well known Japanese traditional art. Bonsai are miniaturized potted plants and trees for aesthetic appreciation, and an art form unique to Japan. Basically it is the raising of miniature trees in small ceramic pots. The pine tree is cited as typical, but all sorts of other plants and trees are nurtured. To make the trees beautiful, we wrap the branches with wire and trim them. It takes a lot of skill and experience. For a long time bonsai has gained attention overseas and there has been an increasing trend in cultivating them, and as a new awareness of bonsai has grown, it has become a stylish hobby among many young people. So why don't you experience the wonderful Japanese tradition, by seeing many bonsai at “Shunkaen Bonsai Museum?” The Museum was built upon the desire to spread Japanese culture, especially bonsai in a new way to the rest of the world. Bonsai Class is held every Sunday, 10:00-17:00. Here you can learn about bonsai under the personal guidance of Kunio Kobayashi. The Bonsai you make will become yours to keep.
strTitle: Make Bonsai at Shunkaen Bonsai Museum, Tokyo

strIntroduction: Ena city in Gifu prefecture is a true countryside gem and an ideal destination for a relaxing day trip from Nagoya. The vast area in the rural north part of the city attracts visitors with plenty of great natural spots and beautiful scenery. Travelers who wish to experience Japan's countryside and see splendid natural views off-the-beaten-track should book this tour to Ena city! In this day tour you will ride a private car from Ena Station and will be accompanied by an English-speaking guide. You trip will take you to Sakaori Tanada, one of Japan's 100 best terraced rice fields, the rocky Fudo Falls near Mt Kasagi, the Kasagi Gorge, until you reach Ena city's highlight - the giant Oi Dam and Ena Gorge where you can taste local delicacies and sail on a pleasant sightseeing boat. End this wonderful journey with a relaxing hot spring experience in a radium hot spring - a type rare to find in Japan. At the end of the trip you will have discovered little known hidden spots in the Japanese countryside that only locals know about! Below is the suggested itinerary of this tour: Around 10 am: Ena Station (accessible by train in about an hour from Nagoya on JR Chuo Line). Meet your guide and ride the private car. Drive along the Kasagi Gorge's Kiso River and go first to Sakaori Tanada. The terraced rice fields arranged over the steep slopes offer a breath-taking view that has secured this place a honorable spot in Japan's Best 100 rice fields ranking. The curvaceous ridges of the piled up stones are truly unique and you will have ample opportunities for taking photos. Next, go to Fudo Falls, a 6-meter high waterfall surrounded by giant rocks in a small ravine. The deity of this place is enshrined in a local shrine nearby. During the green season you can buy ecologically clean local products from the direct sales store next to the falls. (The store is closed between November 26 and March 18) Arrive at Oi Dam, Ena city's iconic scenic spot. It was the first dam built on the Kiso River in 1924 by the famous engineer Momosuke Fukuzawa. See the wonderful scenery of serenity from the Sazanami Park, known for its cherry blossom trees and wisterias, and have a light lunch with local foods and sweets. Next, ride on the 30-minute sightseeing pleasure cruise along Kiso River and see unique rock formations. In winter this cruise offers great opportunities for bird watching. Finally, make a short stopover at Ena Radium Onsen, a rare type of hot spring with radium-rich healing water where you can relax briefly before returning to Ena Station for the end of the car tour. Enjoy the beautiful nature of Ena city in this private guided car tour!
strTitle: Explore the vast nature of Ena city, a day trip from Nagoya
